title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Inconsistent scheduling of conversations with recruiters. Ultimately went with another offer before getting very far at this employer due to this. Everyone I dealt with was friendly and overall helpful once getting to speak to them.
Interview Questions: Job experience and pay expectations.

title: Case Management Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Plymouth, MN)
Interview Descriptions: Short screening at first then asked the basic interview questions. Ended up declining the offer because of another offer. Seemed like a great place to work, just lower pay than expected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the time you went above and beyond

title: Project Manager - Historic Data Conversion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied, answered the phone texts inquiry, then nothing until I got an email stating: "We have been reaching out, and we haven't heard back from you yet. Since we haven't gotten a response, our recruiters have made the decision to pursue other candidates..." I didn't get any emails, texts, calls. Online the Workday site says "Application withdrawn by applicant" which I surely didn't do.
Interview Questions: Please select how many years of relevant experience you have for this position. Please select the highest level of education that you have completed.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The number of rounds depends on the department, but first you'll meet with HR, then with a supervisor, then perhaps the PI or doctor in charge or with a peer panel. It takes a while to go through the entire process which is a little frustrating, but everyone has generally been nice.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of the position?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Application was for the innovations department. 6 rounds including a panel, a lengthy research case study that took about 10 hours, a meeting meeting with the MD, and other 1 on 1 interviews, all after the screener. Process took 4 months. Frustratingly slow to respond and all updates required effort to hear back. Didn’t help that HR got shuffled midway through process and I was not informed at all.
Interview Questions: They were repetitive interviews that were fairly straightforward/ tell me about yourself (over and over). Case study required extensive research online to look up details about the market of a medical procedure.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview, but she actually called me a little bit earlier because said her schedule is a little bit hectic and wanted the chance to speak with me so it wasn’t really the interview that I thought I was going to be having, but she was very professional, very eager to answer all the questions that I had, and was willing to help me throughout my entire process. It was successful.
Interview Questions: She asked me what cohort I’m graduating with because I was a bit early. I have to reschedule interview For the upcoming cohort

title: Advertising Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and then got a text message the same day with some simple follow up questions such as years of experience, highest level of education completed, and salary expectations. I then received an email to self schedule a virtual interview. I scheduled right away for the earliest date they had available which was almost two weeks away.  Two days away from my scheduled interview, I received one email that my interview was canceled and a second email that was an automated response saying they have chosen to pursue other candidates. This was unprofessional and a waste of my time adjusting my schedule and preparing for an interview that didn’t happen.
Interview Questions: Please select how many years of relevant experience you have for this position.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Miami, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly process I felt comfortable while interviewing and the procedure was quick. Show a sense of humility, study about the company and use STAR method to respond to questions.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: its easy. its better to be certified or have previous experience. they have evening and day shift. no transportation is provided. the interviewers are really friendly, polite and easy questions.
Interview Questions: Q: how do you handle a stress full situation.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was straight forward and was easy. It last for just 25 minutes thought it was scheduled for an hour. The questions they asked was about the previous study and experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and the experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Everything was great for the beginning process but after the interview, no one follows up. I tried reaching out to the recruiter multiple times and I kept being told they will get back to me but never received a response. Four weeks later and nothing. Even after multiple emails and calls.
Interview Questions: It was for an ICU position - so the questions are very in depth about clinical experience and scenarios.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: exciting and interactive. The interview board was very cooperative and friendly and allowed me enough space to answer their questions. The questions were also very specific to my experience and also my personality
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for Cleveland Clinic

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Warrensville Heights, OH) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great process and very inviting and informative, questions were spot on and the tour was amazing and gave a clear insight to day to day tasks and responsibilities. Would do it all over again .
Interview Questions: What had been your most difficult assignment and how did I handle it .

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great interview, I got the job. Very personable and informative. So happy now that I am a part of the Cleveland Clinic. Great place to work. Have always dreamed of being a nurse at this great hospital
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: EHP Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was so enthusiastic about all of my experience. After I interviewed with a manager, I figured I didn’t get the position. She was hung up on the fact that I mainly have pediatric experience. Over 20 years as a RN with a Masters degree and multiple years in Care Coordination, I was beyond qualified for the position. The manager was not interesting, didn’t know how to answer the questions I had and generally did not seem engaged in the interview. She was at home on zoom and seemed preoccupied with whatever was going on in her home. She said she had to discuss with another manager and the team. I received a declined notice a week later. Then the job was reposted. Honestly, I would have declined if offered, the manager was not impressive to work for.
Interview Questions: Really none and the manager had a hard time answering mine.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 interviews. One phone interview and one in person the phone interview isn't really hard they asked a few questions mostly pertaining to if the salary, shift times, and location is good for you and other regular interview questions. The 2nd interview is more in depth so be prepared and do your research.
Interview Questions: How are you with faced paced environments? How has previous work experienced impacted the type of worker you are? Questions obout conflict and problem solving skills.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by the hiring manager and one person from the team. The interview was most conversational with some SQL questions and questions about database concepts. The specific position was looking for experience with Service Now reporting.
Interview Questions: How do you normalize tables? Whats the difference between JOIN and LEFT JOIN in SQL?

title: RN Nurse Professional Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and was initially contacted by hiring manager. After initial phone screen, sent an invite for a virtual interview with HR. It was a live interview. Then scheduled for a panel interview to answer more questions and do a 5 minute ppt presentation.
Interview Questions: Standard questions, nothing stood out. Shared my presentation to a panel I couldn't see- no questions or comments from the panel, who did not turn on their cameras, except for one, the entire interview.

title: Information Systems Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: They were thorough with their questions. The answered every one of my questions I asked. I hope someday to be working for them. Great company to work for. Great interview process.
Interview Questions: I asked them about the type of work I be doing at entry level.

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was so simple. Everyone I worked with was extremely kind and upfront. During the interview each supervisor was upfront and clear with their questions or expectations. The other plus was that all supervisors went over the position in full. What is expected out of you as an employee.
Interview Questions: What was one time that you had to learn something new?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview then a video interview then an in person interview. Same kind of questions just worded differently each time. Basic interview questions, why are you a good fit, describe a time when you felt stressed at work and how you handled it. Etc.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had a conflict with another co worker and what was the outcome

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I applied to a few positions. I expressed interest in an area and the HR immediately ruled me out of a few when I was open to all different departments. Interviews were simple. Asked mainly behavioral questions and lasted only 15 minutes. The managers took around 15 minutes to explain the research and to answer my questions. The explanations are very fast and they honestly seem to not like what they do. The most ridiculous part of all of this is the pay.
Interview Questions:
Why the Cleveland Clinjc?
Why are you interested?
How do you stay organized?
What lab experience do you have?

title: Administrative Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I went through the first round of interviews for Undergraduate Administrative Internship Program in December. The experience was smooth and stress-free. 15 minute interview with 3 employees. 3 questions trying to figure out if you know about Cleveland Clinic and the program. I have my second round of interviews soon... fingers crossed lets see how it goes.
Interview Questions: What is one thing that you think Cleveland Clinic can change?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: It was a short interview (15 minutes) which flew by but I thought it was effective in that I got what i wanted to say out. Asked some more technical questions than i was expecting but we’re very kind and understanding when I asked questions of my own. Panel of 3 interviewers.
Interview Questions: how will this position lead you to your career goals?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Simple. And easy to connect with hiring manager. Onboarding process and then start work efficiently. Was happy with how i was communicated with and felt like the conversations flowed well.
Interview Questions: Who are you as a professional

title: Administrative Program Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Very streamlined and fairly quick (for internal hires). Can expect to meet with management fairly quickly after applying. Decisions on hiring are made pretty quickly. However, all of this is the opposite for external hires.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about one of your weaknesses.

title: Medical Resident PGY-1 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Not at all thorough too quick to answer any questions. Entirely online which isn't bad. Ask me questions which I did not have the answer to and could not have the answer to
Interview Questions: What will make you a good resident?

title: Patient Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Willoughby Hills, OH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I've applied to a handful of positions at the clinic within the last few months and each time was different. I would not call it a process as it was disorganized and confusing. For this particular position, I was able to bypass the on-demand video interview since I completed this step for a previous job application. I received an email to schedule an in-person interview with the Clerical Manager. I was able to get in the next day, which was nice. I met with her and a team lead. The interview consisted only of five scenario-based questions. I was never asked why I applied for the job, why I want to work at Cleveland Clinic, or anything regarding my work history/experience in health care, which I found odd. The last part of the interview consisted of a 30-45 minute shadowing experience. I sat with somebody in this role and was able to learn what the job entails and ask questions. I was also given a short tour. I thought this was really interesting and enjoyed it. I left feeling excited about this opportunity. Fast forward to a week later, I received and email from a recruiter I never talked to before to set up a call about my interview. I spoke with the recruiter on the phone and was offered the position. I was very excited until he started going over details about pay, which had not been discussed before. I figured if they wanted to move forward with me, they would have me do another interview, where I would ask more detailed questions about pay, benefits, etc. I was completely blindsided by the pay being offered (19.50/hour). I asked if there was any flexibility and he responded in a very positive way, making it seem as if this would be no issue. He stated he needed to reach out to the compensation department to see if they could approve me for the pay I wanted, which was $2 more per hour. I got off the phone call feeling hopeful and looking forward to hearing back within a couple days. I received an email about 3 business days later with the news that they were unable to approve anything more than the offered amount. I was extremely disappointed that they could not spare as little as fifty cents more an hour for a well-qualified candidate who was extremely interested in the position. For background, I have a Bachelor of Science, as well as a Master of Health Administration with almost 10 years of total health care experience. This felt like a slap in the face and made me feel undervalued. I responded by politely declining with a short explanation as to why this will not work for me. I received no response. In conclusion, I feel that many peoples time was wasted due to a pay range not being discussed upfront.
Interview Questions: There were 5 questions asked. Questions consisted of "Tell me about a time you were faced with a stressful situation in the workplace and how you handled it" and "Describe how you handle working with a difficult coworker." I can't remember the others but they were similar workplace questions to see how I responded during those situations.

title: Senior International Payer Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Via Linkedin, I applied directly on CC's website. I did not mark on LinkedIn that I had applied. A week later there was a request from the Director to do so again, and he would follow with a phone screening. I did as requested and marked complete on LinkedIn. He DID NOT follow through.
Interview Questions: The Director / hiring manager did not follow through the phone screening as he indicated he would.

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: the interview has a total of 3 rounds, I stopped at the 2nd round. 1st round is phone screening, 30mins 2nd round is a technical interview, which gave me several questions related to survival analysis and regression analysis, 1 hour
Interview Questions: what is OR in logistic regression sample size general linear model cox proportional hazard model

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was just a phone interview. Asked basic question about my experiences. I just got out of school so I don’t have a lot of job experience. I talked about my volunteering experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience? What you are looking for?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring manager was a joke. He was eating, while interviewing. How unprofessional and rude. Educate those rude folks please.

HR screen and then interview with a hiring manager and his folks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview process with standard questions. Nothing too challenging, phone interviews & in person. Great opportunity to get experience here. In person was typical interview questions. Be prepared with resume, why you're a good fit, etc.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this role?

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, did a HireVue video interview, got called in for an in person interview and shadowed someone right after. All of this took about a week. They said they would be in contact within 3-5 days for next steps! So far has been a straight forward process. Easy interview questions you'd expect to hear.
Interview Questions: How does your background make you qualified for this position?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial brief phone interview with taken acquisition and then an interview with a senior director and then second panel interview with entire team where I was asked multiple questions. Process was pretty smooth and took a few weeks before an offer was extended.
Interview Questions: Why’s re you interested in this role and showcase and explain what you did in your previous role.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: 3 total interviews. The first is a phone call with HR. THe second interview was with the department manager. The last interview was with the team (other coordinators, manager, lab techs). The interviews were easy and asked mainly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: All behavioral questions - biggest conflict and how I solved it

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Start with a phone interview with the recruiter and then move to in person where you speak with management and other staff members working on the unit and have a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose the Cleveland Clinic?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Tough. Very long and tiring. Did not get an answer back from employer for awhile. Which is weird, since they were desperate for staff. I don’t know why I need to do this just to look at a companies reviews. This is ridiculous.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't that bad. They just wanted to get to know you, make sure you would fit in the culture, otherwise they'd train you. Had to make sure the hours matched. That you were okay with the schedule and taking orders from the lead. Pay was not very good.
Interview Questions: Q. Tell me about a time you helped a customer in need.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Pretty normal process, the recruiter who spoke to me was kind of rude. Overall the benefits and pay seemed fair. The interview itself was normal, I had a few software problems that I had to answer and solve.
Interview Questions: Technical questions and standard behavioral questions

title: Patient Care Nurse Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone interview waited some time  did the drug screen the next month started working with them great experience . I loved working with them  & would do it again
Interview Questions: Where was the last time u worked

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Ineffective method in notifying candidates that they have been selected to the next rounds of interviews. HR withdrawn application rather than email as a follow-up from the initial standard rates apply text.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Development Associate Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was lengthy. It was a month before I heard from them. HR emphasized they were looking for someone they could groom to take over when the Director retired (to me that was a nice way of saying someone young - I am the same age of the Director). She also told me they were hoping it would grow into full-time- again over time so this person could replace the Director. That is not what the job description was. It took another month to meet with the Director. It took another month to get the rejection email.
Interview Questions: Would I be interested in being groomed into a full-time Director position from the part-time position associate position I applied for.

title: High Volume Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a recorded interview. From there, I had a zoom interview with the Hiring Manager and then a zoom interview with the team of four people at once.
Interview Questions: Know why you want to work for the organization and be able to articulate it clearly.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Never heard back from hiring manager after the second round, despite him promising to. My follow up email was ignored. This is unprofessional. Then other departments in CCF have 5 rounds of interviews, which is a waste of time. If you can't make up your mind after 2 interviews, I wonder what that says about your decision-making abilities. That or you're overly concerned about making sure you make a good hire. Which is fair, but to do so at the candidate's expense is not right.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: It was a decent interview by one of the department managers. He was nice and easy to talk to. The questions weren't too ridiculous. It also made it clear what roles the position would include.
Interview Questions: What experience in working in hospitals do you have?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was a pleasure to meet, some disorganization was definitely noted. Overall wasn’t a bad experience. I think if they were communicating better with one another it would of been smoother for me.
Interview Questions: What do you do to recharge yourself outside of work?

title: Clinical Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and well communicated, which was a positive. However, the acceptance and onboarding for my position has been a negative experience. There was no option to negotiate the low salary they offered. They expect me to pay for my own uniform after not budging on salary or benefits negotiations. Already I do not feel valued. To add to this feeling of not feeling valued, when I went to get my badge, they state I must have my legal name on it. I am transgender and this is discrimination against my gender identity and using my preferred name. My deadname now must be everywhere and I do not feel valued or respected as a human or employee. I feel stuck because I need health insurance, but the Cleveland Clinic did not give a good first impression.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your background.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied to listing on website. Telephone interview with outside recruiter - typical questions e.g. why Cleveland Clinic, salary expectations, etc. Also described role to me - would move person around to various departments and asked if I was ok with that. Then said next step was resume review by senior recruiter. If still interested, they would call me. Did not make it past this step.
Interview Questions:
Salary expectations
Why Cleveland Clinic
Understand that the position is currently remote
COVID vaccination

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: A few questions regarding my work history.  This was done over the phone from a recruiter.  The recruiter went over pay scale as well and briefly touched on benefits offered.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a stressful situation?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have no complaints about the interview process itself. The process was smooth, quick, and the people I interviewed with were wonderful. Salary expectations were discussed in the very first conversation I had with the recruiter and since this was a lateral move from my current position my expectation was to not take a pay cut from where I was currently at. I was sent through the entire interview process only to receive an offer $15K less than what we had discussed up front. What is the point of asking about salary expectations and wasting time of the candidate and interviewers knowing that amount could not be met.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for the Cleveland Clinic?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Depends on the manager that you are picked. But my manager did not ask me as much questions as I thought I would be getting. Mostly, she explained to me what exactly they do on the floor.
Interview Questions: What made you pick Cleveland clinic?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: They require many letters of req. It is best if you do your senior practicum or clinicals at one of their sites- they often hire straight from there.  They also require a video interview. I think that this may seem very intimidating, but it actually is not.
Interview Questions: Tell me a about a time when you disagreed with a coworker?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Was very thorough- it was about a 3-4 interview process with typical interview questions and also some scenario based questions. Included shadowing the position before receiving an offer which was nice

title: Patient Service Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Series of questions regarding work experience and Personal characteristics (how you deal with difficult patients or new changes etc)


I especially appreciate that if you have questions their staff are really prepared with answers about the company itself and the roles that they’re hiring for.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview

Interview Questions: Describe a time in a previous job where something abruptly changed, and how did it affect you.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The first interview process is having a video interview.  You read through a series of questions and answer back through a video. The process is quick and really makes you think.

title: Intern Interview

title: Lab Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview was completely virtual; they asked to record and submit responses. This led to a disconnect between the hiring managers and I. It felt very un-personable and I would have preferred to speak with real interviewers.

title: Physical Therapist Interview

Goals in 5 years
Experience in prior hospitals
Availability

title: Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was so smooth and organized. My application went straight to the hiring manager so I didn't have an interview with a recruiter. I interviewed with two people from management and they made me feel so comfortable from the start. We went over my background, why I applied for the position, a few behavioral-based questions went over job duties, and a little bit about the department.  The next day I was invited to come in for a peer panel interview and job shadow. Everyone was so kind and welcoming during the job shadow, I only have positive things to say. I received an offer 1 week later.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you couldn't finish a job and needed to leave it for the next shift.

Describe yourself in 3 words

title: RN Neurovascular Stroke Clinical Nurse Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive interview with pertinent questions re my knowledge, skills, educational background.  Highly professional and respectful.  First interview is by phone, second is zoom, third is with the department.  At the third meeting, a group of staff had the opportunity to ask questions of me.  I was also able to ask questions such as pace, congeniality, level of team work, educational opportunities, and patient satisfaction.
Interview Questions:
Why do I want to work here.
Previous experience.
How can I bring value to the team.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and short yet hard and long at the same time. Asked lots of questions about finance. Asked what my preference for work mode be (remote, in-person, hybrid). They asked what prior experience I had.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Cleveland Clinic?

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Pretty laid back  asked questions about experience. Didn’t talk too long or with more than 2 people at a time. Seemed easy enough for an interview. Sat in a room with a big table and looked over my resume and asked questions based on that
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Grant Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Las Vegas, NV)
Interview Descriptions:
A month of calls and emails.  Spoke to numerous people in the organization, I was kept in the loop of the process every step. 

The actually interview was odd.  First, when I first applied for this role they called it a Project Manager role which it wasn’t, it ended up being a grant administrator role.  The interviewer asked me questions pertaining to IT programs (what does that have to do with grant administration?) and what my favorite Disney character was (also thought this was odd).

Overall the process leading up to the interview was pleasant but the actual interview felt unprofessional like they were trying to give me “gotcha” questions or trick me into answering wrongly.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite Disney character and why?

title: Inst Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Great process simple questions the interviewer was very personable and social.  I don't know what else you want me to say. the interview process is easy the interview process is ok
Interview Questions: how will you contribute to the team

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: This is a fast paced work environment expect to handle 200-300 phone calls a day.  Typically a panel interview with 6 to 8 people. I received a response back from hr within 24 hours.
Interview Questions: What department was I interested in?

title: Physician/Neurologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Bellevue, NE) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really challenging. There were times that I was nervous but it was a very nice experience, I must say.  I look forward for a job in the next one.
Interview Questions: How do you determine the severity of a disorder?

title: Front End Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and easy. They offered me the job and we proceeded to start the hiring process. But about 2 weeks later THEY WITHDREW THE OFFER WITH NO EXPLANATION!
Interview Questions: If I could have any superpower, what would it be?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: There are two parts. They ask basic  questions and vey welcoming and very nice, It was not intimidating process. I was surprised they did not delve into my experience with research.
Interview Questions: Provide me 3 weaknesses and 3 strengths.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: You meet with a panel of supervisors/managers of the job position you're applying for. They ask a series of different questions. Then you do a knowledge/skills review to see if you're capable of basic duties you'd be completing from day to day.
Interview Questions: Is it important to do right thing or do things right?

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cle Elum, WA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process did move quickly except the decision phase where I was basically ghosted. I tried giving a relevant example in my recruiter interview and she had no idea what I was taking about. I get she’s a general recruiter but this wasn’t something technical at all. When I got to the group interview the panel basically made it evident that they were bored and disinterested before I even opened my mouth. Other than tell me about yourself, they had no questions prepared and it was super awkward. Overall didn’t feel welcoming or like I was anything other than checking a box.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this.

title: Clinical Exercise Physiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I scheduled an interview with the CC.  We had a time set, and I did not receive a phone call.  I emailed them back and we agreed on the following day.  I never heard back, and upon my own research found out they filled the position without ever contacting me, despite having interview arrangements
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Great. Individual screening and then did a panel with a few team members and then did a final. All went well and he did great. Lasted over the course of one month from start to finish.
Interview Questions: General types of questions were asked

title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straightforward interview with the nurse manager. It was mainly a conversation, not a question and answer type of interview. Fortunately management and the team is amazing. It will be hard to leave.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: HireVue video interviewing to start, followed by a short call where the recruiter gave extremely vague details about the job itself, followed by a video interview with a panel of 7 each asking 1 question. I will be honest, I did not do well in this interview at all. I am used to turning an interview into a big flowy conversation and this one was almost impossible to do that with, as it just went from person to person asking random things that didn't intertwine. After all of this, radio silence. I'm not shocked I didn't get the job... though I find the lack of communication obnoxious.
Interview Questions: What is your current req load.

title: RN BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Met with the unit director and interviewed.  Also got to shadow on the unit, post interview.  Great experience to get to see and feel the vibes of the unit.  Interview was very thorough and had a lot of questions, but conversational in style.
Interview Questions: Name one word to describe yourself.

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, was called by the recruiter in 3 days, did a phone interview right there with her. Basic questions and overview of the position, stated what the pay starts at. I then had an interview with a hiring manager less than a week later. The questions were really just asking  about yourself. A day later I received a call stating they were interested and were moving things forward, got a formal offer a week later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a customer

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was easy, it was very comprehensive it was a good opportunity but I would say that it is interesting. It was rather hard to get a interview though.
Interview Questions: What is the reason for you getting into healthcare?

title: Costumer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Bellevue, NE) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. I walked in,answered some questions,  asked them some questions. Meet the team, and saw the location I would be working at. It was very pleasant and good to know.
Interview Questions: How I well I was doin.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Uniontown, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was very fast and efficient. No in person interview required. Even though the interview was virtual, it was still very personable. Following the interview, I was contacted within a day with an employment offer.
Interview Questions: Would I be available to occasionally cover at other satellite outpatient facilities.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Terrible process.  Lack of communication, and no focus on their reputation as an employer.  Yes, they are a top hospital, but their interview process is awful.  After my onsite interview, I received an automated email, 3+ weeks later.  Not disappointed at not getting an offer, as I was going to turn them down, due to their lack of empathy during the interview process, and the overwhelming responsibilities of this backfill position.
Interview Questions: Questions about data management, understanding, and process.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Port St Lucie, FL) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It took about 1 hour long. We used Zoom platform, and I've prepared a 15-min long presentation about my research interests and my future plan.
After this interview, the professor requested the three reference letters, and after that, I did a 20-min long presentation for the laboratory members.
Interview Questions:
1) Please introduce your self 
2) why did you apply for this position 
3) my long term goal 
4) research interests - current study, phd thesis...
5) Do you have any questions?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview went good.  Questions was common questions asked to all the applicate.    Interviewer describe the job duties.  Cleveland hospital after interview process is a long process to start working with them.
Interview Questions:
How do you handle 200 calls from a daily tasks?

Why do you applied for this position?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Medina, OH) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Starts with an application and a lengthy wait for a recruiter to reach out, you'll have to text a robot before the recruiter though. Then you have a short phone interview,  most of it is them telling you about the position and others available nearby, very few questions about you and your experience.  Then you'll have either a video interview or an in-person interview, once again I wasn't asked many personal questions,  just what my coworkers would say about me, how I would handle conflict with a coworker, and how my attendance was at past jobs.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: Senior Director, Population Health Initiatives Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Vero Beach, FL) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met several key players over the course of two interviews.  Typical questions were asked about my experience and how my experience would be applicable to the position.  Someone from HR followed up with me throughout the process to inform me of where I stood in the interview process.  Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Typical questions were asked about my experience and how my experience would be applicable to the position.

title: Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual with a team from the office, everyone was very personable and very honest about what to expect. I appreciate the honesty and thoroughness of the description of the job .
Interview Questions: Could I handle working in a fast paced environment?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Easy, quick, standard questions that are situation based scenarios. I was asked questions about how would I deal with a difficult patient or questions about time management and delegation in a patient scenario.
Interview Questions: Questions about time management, delegation, strengths/weaknesses.

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: An interview questions were appropriate.  HR sat in on interview very different. The atmosphere was average. Able to display my previous work and creativity. Able to share my interest and skills in detail.
Interview Questions: What's your interest in the job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick, smooth, and  painless. HR was very responsive to all emails and questions. They helped to facilitate communication between myself and the hiring manager. There was an initial interview with HR, interview with managerial team and a shadowing opportunity given to me to make sure the position was a good fit for both parties.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the department??

title: Student Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Beachwood, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied, Phone interview , in person interview with Nurse manger for about an hour  , all with in 2-3 days
Then an offer, orientation started 2 weeks later great environment and you have everything right there
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to work with a difficult person?

title: Biostatsician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: No phone interview, only video interview. First, Three HR from different teams introduce themselves. Second, let you introduce your background and then ask you some behavior questions and technical questions.
Interview Questions:
1. What would you do if you met a research topic you never heard of. 
2. How could you balance the statistical project work? Understand research topic,  Data collection, and Statistical programming.
What is logistic regression?  What is the Odds ratio?
Explain an example of a survival study method?
Give an example of the non-parametric model?
How to calculate the minimum sample size of a two-sample t-test? 
Fixed effect vs Random effect.
Give an example of Repeated measurement.

title: Business Continuity Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Asheville, NC) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial then panel interview. The program director was part of the interview process. Over Zoom.  Wanted to see if you were a good fit for the team.  I thought I did well during the process, was not given feedback afterward.
Interview Questions: Varied, focused on STAR format

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Garfield Heights, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was Over the phone I’m guessing it’s the first interview I have another interview with actual employment opportunities with the mangers of Cleveland clinic I’m very eager to do this interview and succeed with this process
Interview Questions: Do I have cna experience

title: New Grad RN Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Discussion, followed by shadowing. I met the Nurse Manager, the ANM, and then shadowed a floor nurse. I learned about the unit culture, the staffing ratios, the philosophy on health of the unit and care for people and patients. I learned about the hospital and the wider community as an ecosystem, and the opportunities there.
Interview Questions: What I value, why I want to be a nurse, my experience

title: Staff Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Full day of interviews with multi disciplinary faculty in specialty field of interest, interview with Department Chair, tour of facilities and met other faculty and support staff, job talk presentation
Interview Questions: career goals, reason for interest in Cleveland Clinic, 5-year vision

title: Research Texhnician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview judging interest of the research. Wasn’t super in depth, but was friendly. Onboarding through occupational health takes some time which is also kind of supposed to be expected at such a large hospital
Interview Questions: Past experience and why are you interested in the position

title: Information Technology Service Desk Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I applied online about a month ago, shortly after I get an incomprehensible email from a recruiter asking for me to email another recruiter my availability. Erring on the side of caution, I send them both my availability and never hear anything back.  Today, I got an email informing me I never responded to them. Very, very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Supply Chain Management Co-Op Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview carried out over the phone. Interviewer was friendly and straightforward, starting with the basic screening questions (which were not part of the online application process) and then asking me to go over my educational and working experiences. The interviewer gave useful information that helped me notice that I wasn't interested in the specific job duties, he then transferred my profile to another department to further review.
Interview Questions: Can you go over your resume/experiences for me?

title: PFA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over zoom. There were about 7 different people in the interview process. Afterwards I was able to shadow two of the employees. They were both every helpful and answered questions I had.
Interview Questions: Tell me a specific time when you had to work with a difficult patient.

title: Remote Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I really wasn’t expecting this kind of interview.  Where an automated system asks you question and you have to video your response.  There should be some human interaction.  I felt like it was very generic and out on the spot a few times.  I understand your a large cooperative but how can you really get the feel of a person response when they are recorded.  I didn’t like this system at all.  I didn’t get an offer but I was already  put off by the interview so that was ok with me.
Interview Questions: I would prefer not to.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick and thorough. I appreciate them taking the time to select the most appropriate candidate. The response times were fast and communication was clear. They answered all questions very clearly and made me confident in the position.
Interview Questions: What was your experience in PA school like for this specific speciality?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was very pleased with my experience.  The entire team was extremely professional.  The moved through the process quickly and felt like my time was valued.  The team was very transparent about the role and salary/benefits.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were put in a challenging situation and how did you overcome.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy.  However, the problem wasn't the interview- it was the offer.  $18.88/hour.  I have a Master's Degree in the field the research was in.  The Bibibop down the street from me advertises that wages start at $18.00/hour there.  They wanted to pay me a fast food employee salary for a master's degree job?  I laughed and politely declined.  I heard salaries were lower at the Cleveland Clinic, I never suspected they were this low.
Interview Questions: What research experience do you have?

title: Organizational Development Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
A very friendly and professional interviewer.
Helpful and caring.
Asking only relevant questions.
Anyone would feel comfortable with such an interview.
Honest comments.
The timeline was described. 
What else one candidate would expect?
(I have told everything!)
Interview Questions: Why would we hire you?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The HR called and set up phone interview. After that, I got an in person interview with manager and associate. Be prepared to answer clinical questions. After the interview, you will shadow a nurse from 30 minutes to an hour.
Interview Questions: How your peers describe you?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied after seeing post on LinkedIn. Received an invitation for hirevue video interview and a week later received an email invite for 1:1 video interview with hiring manager. Hiring manager provided great overview of job, future career growth, and team structure. Received email for another round of interviews with direct team members (4 total not including me). Everyone was really friendly and asked behavioral related questions. I felt at ease answering questions and could see myself working with the team. When I asked about next steps, they were clear on process. They advised me they would debrief and follow up with hiring manager and I would receive update typically within 24 hours. The following day I received a call from main poc with offer! Overall a really positive candidate experience.
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional. The interviewer was very late so I had to wait in the lobby. The person was also chewing gum during the process so it was very distracting. Seemed very rushed and unorganized.
Interview Questions: How do I deal with change?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is fair. It starts with a phone interview and leads to an interview on the platform HireVue. Following the interview on HireVue there is an in person interview with the hiring manager, other project managers, and individuals across different departments.
Interview Questions: What is your 5-year plan?

title: Coordinator ll Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Transparent interview process. Detailed responsibilities, expectations and structure were provided. I was given a tour of the office and met some of the team. I am grateful for the opportunity. The manager and team are in great communication with each other.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to handle a difficult client/patient. How did you react and deescalate the situation.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at the hiring event. It was a positive and professional environment. I had a great experience with the recruiters, nurse managers, and other staff there. I would recommend interviewing at their hiring events.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: Regulatory Compliance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: This was a screening interview.  The interviewer was professional, good listener, pleasant, positive, and controlled the interview well.  He answered all my questions and explained the next steps.  I was very happy with the outcome.
Interview Questions: If I was OK with traveling.

title: Revenue Cycle Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Four Person panel which included Director, Manager, Supervisor and another Analyst  behavioral based questions although informal as it was on Teams.  friendly and informative. The interview was a little over 30 minutes
Interview Questions: Why your are the best candidate

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online, and the email me to schedule the interview and ask to come with professional dress . The interviewer was really nice and Hr follow up with me
That was a great experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about tour self

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was detailed and not too complicated. I enjoyed it and I am also glad that is it over. The answers they gave to my questions were a little bleak but it happens.
Interview Questions: How experienced are you at interviewing?

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I went in, spoke with the manager and assistant manager about the job and what duties I would be responsible for. Asked questions about the unit and then i was walked around the unit. I met a few of the nurses and the other techs and also was able to ask them questions. Overall it was a smooth interview process!
Interview Questions: Why do you think you will a good addition to this job?

title: Clinical Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, get email from recruiter, do initial video interview on your own time and have to record yourself answering questions. you get 3 minutes to answer each question and 3 tries to record yourself if you didn't like your response the first or second time then if there interested they will contact you.
Interview Questions: What was your greatest achievement in your career?

title: Patient Care Nurse Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Asked situation related questions. The nurse manager was very nice and the other girls I shadowed were very nice as well. It seemed like a great Unit to be apart of.
Interview Questions: What I would do if I walk in and the patient is unresponsive

title: Global Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with department lead. Then additional individual interviews with others in the same department or collaborating departments. Each interview is about an hour. Each individual was nice but also very professional.
Interview Questions: Typical questions about the job. However, they do ask strategic thinking questions

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: automated video interview. You are asked a series of questions then asked to record your responses. Asks general questions that can be expected from most interviews. Overall not a bad experience
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous research experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Easy & organized. Several steps starting with a phone interview with recruiter then a phone interview with hiring manager then a face to face interview with manager on unit and a shadow of hospital floor
Interview Questions: How long have you been a nurse

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Theee was a large interview group. Standard interview questions. The hiring process in total probably took about 2 months. After the interview it took about 2-3 weeks to hear back.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty smooth and fast interview process beginning with a video interview and ending with a call from the unit manager and a recruiter.  They are very responsive.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Cleveland Clinic?

title: Contract Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Simple questions about my history, experience, etc. 
 Salary expectation was discussed. Interviewer was handled by a higher up person in HR and they were extremely professional. Overall, professional, calm and very straightforward.
Interview Questions: What is one kind thing you did for someone recently at work?

title: Patient Serives Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview, with a comprehensive consideration of Covid-19 protocols. Interview reviewed the position adequately and with good information. The interviewed was realistic about the job description and how it related to my experience.
Interview Questions: What was a time you experienced a difficulty patient interaction.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: On call then in person and eventually moved to me coming down to the office it was pretty quick but it wasn’t nearly as scary as everyone made it out to be. Definitely a relaxed but business setting
Interview Questions: Q: How would you benefit the team by being in our department?

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview went really well. I was asked all the right questions and they really went into detail about the position. They told me what my every day routine would be like and what to expect while working.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Describe a difficult situation and how did you handle it? Do you have a weakness? If so what is it? Where do you see yourself in a few years?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Many behavioral based questions, tell me about a time when and what was the outcome. Organized notifications if you are forwarded to hiring manager and if not selected. Rarely chat about regular things like past experience, pretty much just behavioral questions then encouraged to ask questions about the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time you failed and what was the outcome.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I got an email requesting a phone interview with Kim in Cole Eye.  She gave me the choice between different times on two days and I replied right away.  I reached out the day of one of my options since I never heard back and she finally gave me the time.  Interview was worrisome, as she was rude and dismissive, but what really worried me was when I asked about burnout and high turnover, she said that was normal and expected and you had to deal with it when you worked under her.  The interview ended with her stating that she'd schedule an interview the next week with the whole team.  The next week came, and again, no word.  I reached out after 8 days.  Two days later my application was rejected and I revived an email citing my "impatience" with the process as the reason for the reject- despite her incompetence to follow her own timeline.  The email was honestly the most passive aggressive I've ever received and despite currently working at this hospital in a different department, the amount of disrespect I've received from most managers makes me think it's an institution wide problem, and is just the push I needed to lane the clinic.
Interview Questions: Honestly she didn't ask questions- just explained the job and asked what I thought.  I asked her questions though, such as how she personally tried to keep her staff from burnout, which she said she didn't do anything about it

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2021

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal and poorly organized. I was contacted via email about my application. I was asked to list available times for a "brief call." As it turned out, this "brief call" was a zoom interview with the PI, Research Associate, and Research Coordinator II. After the first interview there was a second phone interview with other research coordinators which was positive. Following this interview there were two more phone calls. One with the PI and one with the Research Associate. After already being offered the position, I was advised not to accept the position by the PI and associate because they thought the position would not help my career. I later found out that the position did not officially exist yet, meanwhile they asked for a reference from my current employer. Additionally members of the staff were condescending and unpleasant. The experience was riddled with confusing emails, lack of information, and breaks in communication. Needless to say, the entire experience was disorganized, unprofessional, and wasted 2-3 weeks of my time. Someone may have a better experience with a different PI, but I would not recommend.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in research?

title: Clinical Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
This is a review for the Clinical Project Manager position at Cleveland Clinic in Las Vegas, Nevada in the Lou Ruvo Center for Brain Health.

This position was posted 09/03/20 and I applied on 09/06/20. 3 weeks later the recruiter reached out to me asking to set up an interview time and confirm I was willing to relocate. The recruiter was very honest and mentioned how excited the managers were to interview me. He also told me that relocation fee potentially was not available but if the group wanted me that could possibly be arraigned and that will be based on pre-approved mileage. The salary range was not what I saw online so I had to make sure I could live comfortably based on it. The recruiter did say I can take the weekend to decide on whether I wanted to move forward or not but by that point the hiring manager reached out to me to set up a follow up interview.

My interview with the hiring manager and lead supervisor/administrator of the team was set up a couple days after my conversation with the recruiter. It was through video (Microsoft Teams) and they took notes while I answered questions. It was about a set of 12 questions she had with a "curveball" question at the end. Based on the interview, if you wanted professional growth or to go to school while working, this would not be the position for you. And even though the title is manager, you will be doing administrative assistant tasks as well. It is a 40 hours full time position with demanding workload that needs a commitment of 3 years. I am glad that I was contacted prior to deciding if the salary was worth the move as it solidified that this position was not the position I had in mind to utilize to grow. 3 weeks later I received an email that I was not chosen for the position. The interview process was fairly quickly and took about a month or two from application to final decision.
Interview Questions:
Mixture of situational, behavioral, and nonsense (purpose is to get you past your pre-programmed answers to find out if you are capable of an original thought; used to see how you think on your feet) questions.

Questions:
1.) If you went on a vacation or conference and you had no access to your workstation, how do you handle the backlog and catch up on work missed?
2.) What is the key to ensure your institution is compliant with laws, regulations, and standard SOPs?
3.) Provide an example of when you set an expectation of others and how did they rise or fall to those expectations?
4.) What is the key to have a program run on budget?
5.) Where do you see yourself in 4-5 years?
6.) What is your favorite Disney fairytale and why? (Nonsense question)
