The following Wednesday, I had the interview with the hiring manager, and the following day I was offered the position. I accepted the offer; however, I had to do some onboarding meetings. Part of the onboarding process was to take a physical capability test. I failed, which has postponed my start date. They have a program to help with building up your strength. I will be working with a coach and then I can retake the test in 30 days or longer, whenever I am ready. I am waiting to start the strengthen coaching.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to be a PCNA

title: Physician Assistant-Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Talked over the phone about the position then invited to Cleveland for interview. Interview consisted of 3, 30 minute interviews with different staff members then a Q&A with a physician assistant in current position.
Interview Questions: What interested you in emergency medicine

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5+ months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over the phone due to COVID-19. The nurse manager was nice and lasted around 45 min.  30  min was the unit description and the nurse manager talking and around 15 min of discussions.
Interview Questions: Why Cleveland Clinic?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screening, a panel interview, and a final one on one interview. The interview process moved along in a timely manner and they were very helpful in keeping me updated regarding process.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of questions regarding working with different healthcare providers and the scale of programs/projects managed.

title: Social Work Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer was a social work manager. He asked the usual interview questions, as well as questions related to social work.  I was also asked to provide my approach for a few case studies.
Interview Questions: What are the social work values? How are they demonstrated in the case studies?

title: Environmental Health and Safety Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Euclid, OH) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 2 months. I applied online and was asked to completed a virtual interview through an app, HireVue. It was a question and answer interview and you submitted your recorded answers through the app.  I was selected for an interview which was panel style. The interview went well and I was asked to come back for a second interview. My second interview was a teleconference because it took place during the Covid-19 stay-at-home mandate. The call consisted of the subject matter experts. Telephone interviews are tough because it’s hard to let your personality show through. After the interview, I was asked to submit 5 reference via an online service, SkillSurvey. This is the part I was unhappy with. The references were asked to completed an online survey about you which was pretty lengthy, it was at least 20 questions and it even included written answers to explain strengths and weaknesses.  I had to have 2 manager reviews and the rest could be any other coworkers.  This was frustrating because I had to follow up with one of my managerial references several times for her to complete the survey. After all the hounding of references and jumping through hoops, I didn’t get the job! I was so humiliated that I didn’t get the position and had to tell my references I was turned down and they wasted their time completing such a lengthy survey.  Once asked for references, I thought I was going to get an offer. I don’t know why I didn’t get the job, HR didn’t offer any feedback and I’m wondering if it was something said by a reference. I wish the reference survey wasn’t so detailed because I feel like I’m being judged based off a possibly jaded past employer.  I wish they just verified employment like most employers and not ask for so many references.  Needless to say, I don’t agree with the reference process and they are probably missing out on some good candidates because of it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a behavioral type interview. There were three people in the room doing the interview. They were all taking turns asking me questions. There were a total of five questions.
Interview Questions: A time I went above and beyond for a customer.

title: Ambulatory RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Apply online first.  Set up a Phone interview with recruiter, then meet with hiring manager and shadow job.  Job shadow is usually 2 hours to see how you’d fit in with employees and new job
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult coworkers?

title: Valet Parking Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Dover, OH) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview for the job and we talked the first time. Then I was to have a second interview with the lady and she never showed up. She stopped messaging me back and never called again. I went there and waited for her for over an hour.
Interview Questions: What's your schedule like and can you work weekends?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Customer service, professionalism and cultural driven. Its job specific that includes knowledge specific questions to understand your experience.  The staff is very mindful and sensitive to your predicament during the interview process that they try to remind you to relax and answer to the beat of your ability without pressuring you to fail your interview.
Interview Questions: How well versed was I with cultural differences?

title: Certified Surgical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Mayfield, OH) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first interview is a phone interview.  They ask specific questions about what type of specialty if any, you would like to go into. They also ask what campus you would like to work at,  they also try and get you close to your home for more convenience.
Interview Questions: what specialty service I was interested in

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I completed online application than received an email for a video interview about 7 days later. first as multiple choice questions like are you willing to take a drug test and do you need a work visa than the last few questions were video recorded of you answering them which you only given about 30 second to read the question than it starts recording you you have 3 attempts your answers cant be longer than 3 minutes
Interview Questions: What motivates you to be an health unit coordinator

title: Administrative Interview

Interview Descriptions: Case component and tough questions. They were grilling me with many questions and didn’t really get to know me as an applicant. The case was about 5 minutes long and asked about improving a system. The interview was supposed to be via Zoom but the webcam malfunctioned and it was a phone call instead.
Interview Questions: What do you know about us?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview was short and super easy! 
In person interview was long with one person and then with a panel of 6 people. Overall experience was pretty good. I did wear a suit with heels
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Good and quick. The interview was over video and lasted a hour. A tour was then offered in case I wanted to see the facility and meet the team. Overall it was a pleasant experience
Interview Questions: When can you start the position

title: Operations Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Bath, OH) in Feb 2020

title: Biostatistician Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied for this job in December 2019, and I got two-round phone interviews. The first-round interview focused on the resume. title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very average questions related to customer service. Great team to work with and enjoyed the interview. Make sure to review the job and base answers off of that. Great experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had to make a decision?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (South Euclid, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Preliminary interview with HR, then waited several weeks to hear next steps. The sad part, I reached out to HR after week two to inquire on the status and received no response. Two weeks after that I received an email stating the hiring manager would like to meet with me. 

The kicker, the HR rep sent one email to all the candidates. This place is #1 in heart care but clearly at the bottom of the list when it comes to professionalism and common courtesy.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to join the Clinic?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: They give you a set of scenarios the night before to respond to and give insights on in various study situations. Don’t be afraid to say that a scenario is less than ideal or tell them that this isn’t a tenable situation.

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2 people were interviewing me, then mid-interview, someone else came through the door and then started to ask me questions. It made me super nervous, I thought I didn't get the job, but I did; however, they do not pay well.
Interview Questions:
where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?
do you plan on going back to school?

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Lorain, OH) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: First and foremost ive been patiently waiting to work at the Cleveland Clinic for 3 months. However i took the Tabe test passed and it was overlooked, i was told that i was an good candidate and that the recruiters were highly interested in me. Just to get an email stating that they were pursing other candidates!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Cleveland Clinic?

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a video interview through Hirevue. It took about 35 minutes for completion and they advice you to use the STAR method when answering questions. There were also multiple choice questions.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 rounds of interviews through video chat. The first round interview was with 3 previous interns who now work full-time at Cleveland Clinic. The final round interview was with 2 higher-ranking administrators. First round was great with respectful and engaging interviewers. The second round was extremely rushed and the interviewers appeared uninterested from the start.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral questions + one case interview question (asked about private equity in the brewery industry)

title: Patient Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Wooster, OH) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
A couple days after I applied online I received an email inviting me to participate in a 30 minute interview at my convenience. I had to download the interview app called Hire Vue, which is an app that asks you interview questions with multiple choice answers and also prompts you with open-ended questions, giving you 30 seconds to think about your responses before automatically video recording your answer (you're given 3 minutes to answer - if you finish before the 3 minutes is up you can end that particular recording). The app does give you unlimited times to record practice answers to their practice questions. 

The "interview" is you talking to yourself via your camera on your phone or computer. Once you're finished, the app sends your "interview" to the Cleveland Clinic (or wherever - who really knows).

Maybe a week after my "interview" I received another email asking me to take a typing assessment for the job. I had 3 minutes to type a long passage of mostly nonsensical information with quite a few quotation marks, parentheses, numbers, etc. thrown in. I should have warmed up first, because my typing was definitely slower in the beginning than toward the end. Also, all the extra characters in the text threw me off my game. 

Apparently I didn't pass their assessment, because after a few weeks of crickets from them I got curious and logged into my Work Day account. When I clicked on my application it simply said "Not Selected." 

So that's it. The whole application / interview process (up to the point where I was eliminated from of the pool of candidates) is 100% online and automated and 100% impersonal. My husband commented that the Cleveland Clinic appears to treat job applicants and the process like a "meat market." A former colleague of mine who had previously worked for the Cleveland Clinic said he didn't like it because he was "just a number."

I was pretty put off by the whole thing. I mean, I basically interviewed myself, and they didn't even have the courtesy to program an automated rejection email into their process. 
This job wasn't even in my top 3 desirable jobs, so to be so carelessly rejected and cast aside is a bit of an insult. I guess it's for the best though, since I wasn't crazy about the position.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that qualifies you for this position?

title: Administrative Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy and the lady I interviewed with was extremely friendly. She made me feel very comfortable. It was intimidating going to Main Campus, but the woman met me in the lobby and walked with me to her office. I did not feel like she was testing me in anyway, she was just very great. The interview lasted about 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: Strength/Weaknesses

title: Physician Assistant Interview

They paid for air fare, hotel, and transportation while here! Very generous and hotel is extremely nice! I spoke with the Regional Manager before the interview and then met her the following morning. She was great! I met with the doctor at his office, met his staff, and the PA team.  A really solid experience.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations? With physicians and patients.

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by phone after applying many days after. Set up for an in person panel interview. STAR questions were asked, hours were discussed. I’d say it was a low stress interview with pleasant interviewers.

title: Lpn Interview

Tell me about yourself?
Say in 3 words what your last employer would say about you?

title: Pcna Interview

What?? I was told all interviews went well but they were pursuing other candidates. So it does not matter how far you get into the hiring process the job is not officially yours until it is in writing.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you encountered a difficult or angry customer.

title: Clinical Geneticist Interview

title: Employee Health Nurse Interview

title: Pcna Interview

Interview Questions: How will you contribute to...

title: Patient Access Representative Interview

title: Executive Assistant Interview

Describe a purchase order
What is your strength? 
Example invoices
Know the whole Accounts payable process
How would you rate your excel skills?

title: Medical Transcriptionist Interview

Have not applied for Cleveland Clinic again and not sure if I would consider working for them.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was a third fold process: 
Step 1: An e-mail will be sent from a recruiter requesting a telephone interview. The interview will consist of behavioral questions, and is your chance to ask about rotating shifts, pay, benefits, nurse to patient ratios, etc. 
Step 2: The recruiter will send your responses to the unit manager to see if she/he would like to conduct an interview. If the hiring manager wants to interview you an appointment will be set up and you will have 24 hours to request and submit references.
Step 3: In-person interview and shadowing of unit. This process takes anywhere from 1-3 hours depending on the unit and the managers. The shadowing portion is still part of the process and keep in mind it is your opportunity to see what the staff likes about working on the unit and what they do not like working on the unit. title: Digital Marketing & Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the job online. About a week later, I was contacted by HR, who asked routine questions regarding the position, as well as several behavioral questions. I was brought in for an interview with the director and manager of digital marketing. 

The interview focused on the technical components of the job, and was heavy on background experience, with a focus teamwork. There were several behavioral questions peppered into the fray as well. Overall, they were nice: one stiff and calculated, the other jovial and forthcoming. 

When I asked about the position, both struggled to coherently sum up its duty within in 60 seconds.  

I was called for a second - final - interview with a panel that consisted of fancy titles. They required I submit 5 references in advance, two of which had to be former managers. If you haven't yet experienced the joy of working with the SkillShare system, buckle up. 

The second interview focused on background experiences. Each panel member asked questions related to their specific field. Some of the questions included classics such as "tell me about a time," or "how would you say you." Overall, not bad. 

What I found incredibly eye opening was how the marketing account services director explained to the panel that a rock star for the position is someone that thrives in the gray area. This was in response to my question regarding the role and how it interfaces with various departments. 

Could be my rigidity and lack of experience working in cross-functional teams nixed me. 

Either way, I hope this helps the next person who applies for the role. Don't fret about technical PPC aspects too much. They work with an agency who manages the campaigns and turns the dials. They also have an in-house data science team. 

Focus more on your experiences using the STAR approach. Answer before they ask. 

Sadly, HR did not have the courtesy to notify me of a decision, even after I reached out to the formerly responsive individual in HR. 

This speaks volumes about their hiring practices. Anyone can talk a big game, but true communication fell through at this critical junction. I was just another number in a game where speed matters most. Churn and burn. 

Finalists spent a lot of time reaching out and gathering references, taking time out of their day, preparing and writing follow up notes. Such as shame. 

To the next lucky candidate - scratch the thank you notes and traditional hokus-pokus. I'm guessing they have a rigid policy. This is not a cushy job where love notes help fill a role. 

Always remember, interview them as much as they interview you. Just the facts. 

#truth

Good luck!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked with a team to complete a project.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the recruiter from CC and asked to apply for a job.  I did that, I performed a phone screening, then one with the hiring manager.  I was called in for an interview with 5 members of the team (two Directors, one manager, and two contributors).  I felt the first interviewer was somewhat of a jerk and either didn't want to be there, or felt I wasn't qualified enough as his tone was one of arrogance.  The next person was a manager and he was a great guy who asked straight forward questions and very personable.  That was followed by two individuals from a Service Desk (Director, Ind. Cont.).  The Director was great (funny and fully of energy), her counterpart was no-so-much.  He was definitely more 'short' with his questions and did not smile much.  My final interview was with the hiring Director.  It went well; however, it seems their organization is too busy trying build a rigid process to fit their problems using non-technical help, instead of hiring some technical people to help design a more flexible one ... one that works.  To me, it appeared they can't see the forest through the proverbial trees.  When I left, I knew I was not a good fit.  This particular organization has some issues and quite honestly, I didn't want to be any part of it.  I advised the hiring manager to remove  me from consideration... she was gracious in her reply and wished me luck.  There are no hard feelings...  and nothing personal against CC or the team that interviewed me.

Interview Questions: Nothing is too hard if you have a good knowledge of biostatistic background. For the scenario test, make sure to test for interaction effects.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I went to job fair. interview went very simply. talked about myself and pretty much got asked when I would like to come in for job shadow. One interview was a group one, with a lot of basic nursing questions - did not get that job. Second interview was with one manager, very simple with 1-2 questions
Interview Questions: What do I know about medical surgical floor

title: Business Intelligence Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews stretched out over a couple months.  Don't get discouraged if you aren't provided any status updates for long periods of time; just when you think you must not be under consideration any longer, they call or email.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from the job

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview was going well until I got to one of the interviewers that I would have been working with had I got the job. When I got to him, he started asking me questions about "how" I was able to obtain my credentials coming from the Cleveland inner city/urban areas. He acted as thought he didnt believe that my resume was real. Ive done some pretty impressive stuff, but I worked hard. I gave him a thorough run down of my journey. But I didnt get the job.
Interview Questions: How did you come from living in Cleveland and getting an education at Tri-C to working for "ABC" company in Waahington DC? Hkw did you pull that off?

title: Behavior Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Step One: Phone interview that asks basic questions such as "what is autism?" "what is your experience with kids on the spectrum if any? "how did you hear about this job?"
Step 2: On site observation in which you go observe classrooms by yourself for an hour and a half-two hours. You ask questions to the teachers and others present in the rooms. After the observation, you are taken to an administrators office for a "formal" interview with an administrator and a BCBA. 
Step 3: If you pass the formal interview, then they will send you two written response questions to answer within 48 hours. 
Step 4: Wait for a response.
Interview Questions: If a student is refusing to get off transportation, how do you handle that?

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Positive and straight to the point, gave a full detailed job description and offered job shadowing,which I agreed too, enjoyed. I did a full physical and drug screen, passed and got offered the job soon after
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a little about yourself?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after a few weeks got an email asking for my writing sample. I send it to them and a week later scheduled an interview. During the interview, they asked about a lot of technical questions.
Interview Questions: What is power?

title: Patient Service Representative/Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Since I graduated from a local university with a Bachelor's degree I had high hopes of working at Cleveland Clinic, being that it is one of top hospitals in our nation. I wanted to further put to use everything that I had learned within my healthcare major. Over the past couple of months I have applied to 92 jobs at Cleveland Clinic. Of those 92 applications I have  only had two phone interviews (the first stage). The first phone interview was for a patient service presentative position. During this "interview" we only went over what is stated on the application. While I tried to answer the questions, the interviewer continued to talk over me by saying "oh that's great," "uh huh," before I could even finish the statement. By her just doing that I knew that I was not going to get the job. When the interview was over, she said that everything was great and that she was sending everything over to the hiring manager. That Friday, I received an email informing me that I was not selected and that "at this time, have made the decision to pursue other candidates." I called back to speak with someone in Human Resources and was told to just be persistent and continue to apply to jobs as soon as they are posted. About 3 weeks later, I received an email to set up a phone interview for a Laboratory Technician position. This phone interview went a lot more smoother as the lady listened to me as she entered the information onto her computer as we spoke. The only difference between this interview and the last was that the interviewer asked me two questions pertaining to conflict resolutions in my past work experience. I answered them perfectly fine and she told me that she would be forwarding my information to the hiring manager. That Friday, I received the same automated rejection/denial email. I do not understand how I am not getting past the first stage in the hiring process, but I am not applying to any other positions here as my goal/aspirations to work here are completely depleted. Good luck to anyone that applies here and is hired.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you faced a major obstacle at work.

Tell me about a time where you found it hard to work on a team/in a group.

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview.
Rejection after knowing that I have not gotten my Master degree, though this fact can be easily figured out in my resume submitted.
Felt ridiculous and disappointed.
The only useful info I got from the process is that it is a temporary job, which is not mentioned in the online job description.
Interview Questions: Nothing really related to the job

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online, got an email from the recruiters to schedule an interview. selected a time and I had a phone interview with the recruiter.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Akron, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Before the interview I was asked to complete my job references first. After I had done that I had my interview. Took 13 days from the time I interviewed to the time I got the job offer.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good fit for the position

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Solon, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Job fair- I was contacted about the position through hr. And I went in and was excited to see a place where I would thrive with my experience and knowledge. I did however note sadly I was the only white female in the whole place except for an interviewer.  Two white men also were in line. The black employees seemed very friendly towards the black applicants and I was interviewed very quickly by a Hispanic male who appeared hungover to me. He raced through the questions and I followed with a group tour.

I believe the reason I was not offered position was due to my skin color. 
It didn't outwardly seem racist but I observed no other Caucasian employees, that's highly unusual especially since I know a lot of employees and they tell me the people currently working in this center are unable to write or clearly explain simple procedures on appointments and records. Making there job more complicated and time consuming
Interview Questions: So is the only reason you want to work here to get tour foot in the door? Tell me what type of experience you have.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the CC recruiter first in a phone interview. Answered basic questions and let her know I only spoke English. Interviewed with an office manager the next week. First question was if I spoke any other languages, and when I replied no, this was cited as a negative. There does not seem to be  a transfer of information from the recruiter to the interviewer and the in-person interview was a waste of time.
Interview Questions: How would your parents describe you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, streamlined process. I was contacted via e-mail by HR to set up a phone interview with HR and was called for the interview at the time agreed upon. HR started off the interview call by explaining what the unit would be like on a day-to-day basis, then proceeded with a few basic interviewing questions. HR liked what she heard and immediately set up a face-to-face interview with the Nurse Manager of the unit I had applied to, and sent me a confirmation and directions via e-mail. When I arrived at the hospital, a random employee walking outside saw that I was a bit lost and walked a half mile to get me to the right building, and walked me to the elevator that I needed to use. I felt very taken care of! Once I arrived at the unit, I shadowed an RN during a direct admission and the nurse was friendly enough to show me around and answer my questions. I then proceeded to my interview with the Nurse Manager. I let her speak first and once she asked me a question, I ran with it and basically answered all her questions without her having to ask me much. I made sure that I answered every question with a story behind it so that the conversation flowed well. I found ways to lighten up the interview by finding common interests to laugh and talk about. I made sure that I had written down a few questions of my own to ask after the interview was over. She then proceeded to walk me around the unit and introduce me to the staff, as I told her the the team was very important to me in order to make my decision. The staff took time to answer all my questions and even helped me look up apartments in the area. I had a very good experience and felt very welcomed.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your former employer

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy going and the interviewers were great at explaining policies and what the job entailed.  I was given a history of the hospital and a plan for orientating around the facility.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you were in a high stress situation and how you handled it.

title: PBX Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and casual interview. Interviewer was very professional and nice and didn't ask those questions that most jobs ask to many you even more nervous then you already are.
Interview Questions: Nothing, everything was straightforward.

title: Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Edina, MN) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on the company website directly. I was called within 2 days of applying and had a phone interview. After that I was asked to come in for an in-person interview and met with the clinic manager. After a few days I was contacted again and asked to come in for a 2nd interview to meet the team I’d potentially be working with. 
I was told I would be contacted within a week with an answer from the final interview, and 4 days later they called and offered me the job! 
Very great and professional process!
Interview Questions: How do you handle a fast paced environment where you have many things that need to be accomplished at the same time?

title: Clerk Analysis PFS Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Normal behavioral interview questions with a panel of potential coworkers that each would ask you a predetermined question to see if you will be able to fit the role. If you pass this portion you will interview with the director that will ask similar behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Cleveland Clinic.

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
interview with hiring manager, assistant manager and shadowed a health unit coordinator.  Walked through unit and briefly spoke to nurses, other
 peers.  Observed the unit in its entirety regarding EPIC, telemetry, vocera, etc.  Walked unit with employee.
Interview Questions: What stressful situation have you been through and how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview due to being interviewed for position in Cleveland clinic Abu Dhabi. Questions asked about experience and about patient scenarios. Interviewed by nurse manager and assistant nurse manager of floor applying to and someone from HR. interview was about 25 minutes long.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges that were faced being in a charge nurse position?

title: Data Informatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a full 8 hour day that required in depth conversations with each person.  It ranged from extremely technical to interpersonal communication skills.  It seemed a bit much to have that many interviews in one day.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to answer technical programming questions by writing them on paper with zero reference

title: Physician Assistant - MICU Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Rocky River, OH) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through their job website. Followed up frequently with the MICU recruiter who I met at a job fair. Eventually, my information was passed onto the lead APP/hiring manager. Did a phone interview with him approximately 2 weeks after initially applying. Then I was invited for an in-person interview/shadow day which took place approximately a month after I put in my application. 

During the in-person interview, I initially met with the lead APP/hiring manager and a couple of his team. Was given a tour of the MICU. Then I observed on rounds for approximately 60 minutes. Then I had a one-on-one with the MICU director. He was very friendly. Was more like a conversation. Was asked about my long term goals. He mentioned that they are looking for someone who wants to stay in the position for a long time, if not for a whole career. This was mentioned also by the lead APP. 

I then met with another MICU physician, also friendly. Answered a lot of questions for me.  

I then met with one last physician who was slightly intimidating, but not unpleasant at all. Just asked a lot of tough questions, well within reason. 

Then I had lunch with the MICU APPs (PAs and NPs). It was a nice lunch and everyone was friendly. 

Overall the interview was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Do you want to make a career out of the MICU?

title: HUC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Extremely difficult. Interview was short but was followed by shadowing.  Interesting but I felt it wasn't a great interview.  HR recruiters are hard to get ahold of to schedule interviews in the first place.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best choice for this position?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview. The manager was awesome. She made me feel very comfortable in the interview process. To the people who actually worked there.... they are ridiculous, rude, racist, and unfair. I left within my 90 days because of how bad they treated me. i would never go back! That was one of the worst teams i have ever worked with! ( and let me remind you, that was the second time i had worked for the Clinic and i have never had a bad experience anywhere else, but at STJ)
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Received email from recruiter who then set up telephone interview.  On date and time of agreed telephone interview, recruiter never called.  Upon following up, I gave her the benefit of the doubt and figured maybe something came up.  She proceeded to attempt to reschedule the telephone interview but ending up playing email tag in the process.  Once finally re-established telephone interview was 30 minutes long and basically I was asked the usual "general" questions.  At that point, she recommended that I meet with members of legal counsel for an in person interview.  I gave her my availability and after 2 weeks of back and forth email tag (again, because she could not nail down availability of people I needed to meet) we finally determined a date and time.  Initial in person interview went well however at the end of the interview I found it odd that nobody walked me out?  (Basically, I could have wandered the offices).  Once again, received email asking to meet for 2nd in person interview and after an additional 2 weeks of back and forth, emailed the recruiter back to advise I was available and asked her to please confirm the same location and who I should ask for upon arrival.  Waited until the day of the interview and still had not received confirmation that I was expected, where to meet or who to ask for.  Called and emailed the recruiter (received no answer), ended up emailing the hiring attorney to confirm I was expected.  Showed up to interview and was directed to the legal department by the security guard who opened the locked doors for me.  (Nobody could be bothered to greet me in the lobby apparently). Once outside the legal department, I was greeted by someone who then led me to a conference room.  I initially met with an initial 3 individuals (2 attorneys and a paralegal) and began the interview as expected.  Throughout the entire hour long interview a total of 3 additional people entered the conference room late, while 2 others left.  It was a revolving door!  I'd be in the middle of answering a question and people were just coming and going.  Once the interview ended, one of the administrators walked me to the elevator and then again I was on my own to find the lobby.  Long story short, this was probably hands down one of the most unprofessional situations I've ever been in.  Considering the Cleveland Clinic's stellar reputation, I was not impressed!
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to join Cleveland Clinic?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Sheffield Lake, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview with normal interview questions. Lasted about a half hour. I've had many pleasant interviews with the Cleveland Clinic but This select interviewer seemed to want to discourage future education and advancement, if I would have been offered the position I would have declined.
Interview Questions: Do you find yourself to be competitive?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Spoke on the phone multiple times, advised of steps moving forward, told to email with any questions/concerns, and then zero contact including return emails or phone calls. Quite unprofessional given a hospital of this caliber.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Started with online application, then an HR phone screening, senior director one on one interview, followed by a panel style interview with the  team. reviewed my resume and spoke to previous experiences/projects. It was a very friendly but professional atmosphere.
Interview Questions: how do you deal with challenging situations

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was an online interview. Then received call two days later to schedule in person interview. I met with two different groups of people.  They asked basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Report Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Beachwood, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was for a contract role.  Met hiring manager for about 30 minute conversation.  Very relaxed overall.  He described the job and and asked about my prior experience.
Interview Questions: What types of reports did you write in the past?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: it went really quickly, I was employed a month after my interview. Interviewed with both peers and supervisors. They had my resume printed and asked me questions right off the page.
Interview Questions: What are your professional goals for the future?

title: Web Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The Interviewer asked about the same details I already filled while applying online. I replied and she asked about my previous projects as well. And then some behavioral questions as usual.
Interview Questions: Explain about your previous project. Why did you choose Cleveland clinic and some behavioral questions

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. sending resume and letters of recommendation. Upon receiving an email set up a face to face interview. The interview process itself took about 2 months. The first month was essentially the beginning process and month two were for those students who were finalists.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Cleveland clinic?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call back with in the week stating they wanted to do an over-the-phone interview.  The interviewer went over basic questions and asked about my background.  I was then called back for an in-person interview by the hiring manager at the location I had applied for.  It was a basic interview, they asked why I would be a good candidate for this position, and why I wanted to work for the Cleveland Clinic.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you went above and beyond to help someone?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone screening and then an in person interview at the location. An email request for references came over and you have 24 hours to respond. It was all done online and easy to do. I enjoyed the process.
Interview Questions: Why I was looking to change jobs

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place over the phone and was very short in total, about 20 minutes. There were five individuals interviewing me, yet not all were in the same room but were instead conferenced in on the call. It was difficult to hear some of them.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a high workload and stress?

title: Clinical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then onsite interview.  The onsite interview was supposed to be one of three, but I must not have shown enough enthusiasm for sitting at a desk for 8 hours and taking orders from "difficult" doctors.  I feel it's their loss and my win!
Interview Questions: How did I feel about sitting at a desk on n the phone for 8 hours??

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Talent Acquisition team remained in contact throughout several months process. My video was scheduled to comfortably accommodate US and UAE time zone.  Encouraged communication with immediate boss, if they were unable to answer specific position questions.  Be prepared for several month process, but gives you time to fall in love with the idea.  They are looking for dedicated, passionate caregivers.  It’s more than just a travel assignment.
Interview Questions: We are looking for caregivers who work well  with an interdisciplinary approach (i.e., no professional silos).  Tell us about a best practice you support to improve collaborative interdisciplinary patient care?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Beachwood, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview took 2.5 months to schedule and reschedule. The phone interview was rescheduled twice, the face to face interview was rescheduled three times. The Clinic recently outsourced a fair portion of their IT human resources to IBM. This was something I had to ask about in the interview, and I am glad I did. One interviewer out of seven during the four hour face to face ordeal had tears streaming down his cheek when he stated that he had worked with these people in IT for decades, and that many would lose their job in July 2017. When I asked how they would be replaced by IBM employees, he stated that he didn't know how any project would be completed, as most of the resources supporting the Clinic IT infrastructure would simply not be replaced, and the CIO of the Cleveland Clinic left over this decision and others. Not encouraging at all, not the place to be for sure. These knuckleheads had candidates complete a business case. Then it was four plus hours of different people asking you the same questions over and over. Some took notes, others didn't. Interviewers basically stated they had no authority in managing large critical IT projects, and that they felt helpless with the outsourcing of most resources to IBM.
Interview Questions: The best question "How do you feel you would manage a project where no one in the Clinic had authority over the IT resources that had to execute the project?"

title: Clinical Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Miami, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It's a long process with multiple interviews and then a long process to be onboarded. The HR staff seem to be overloaded with applications and move very slowly in getting through them. There doesn't seem to be much collaboration between the physicians and the HR department.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths/weaknesses?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Online application, 2 weeks later got a interview it was 1 hr, really easy. They explain everything about the position and hours. Next step wait for them to call me to offer me the job. Not sure how long it takes after having a interview!!
Interview Questions: Reason why Im applying

title: Appointment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Process was surprisingly disorganized. Interviewer through out my application because he made a mistake that caused me to be unable to attend my interview, despite how hard I worked to correct it and the fact that they are always hiring for this position due to high turnover. Basic questions and he said the pay was $14/hr.
Interview Questions: Phone interview is all about job history and qualifications. Then they'll ask for an in person interview.

title: Senior Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The woman received my CV from a colleague. She reached out to me, sent me a link about her research and she asked me if I would be interested in a Skype interview. She was really great. She start off asking about the weather, and then she proceed to ask questions. She then introduce her research for twenty minutes and asked if I had any questions. I did. The interview went very well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an onsite interview. Phone Interview with research manager. Onsite interview with 2 supervisors followed by interview with 3 peers. Was a question and answer format from their side, then the other half of the interview I had the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: How do you react if a supervisor tells you to throw away certain patient documentation?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: ITs awful, theres so many people you have to meet with and the hoops that you have to jump thru is ridiculous.  You have to keep coming back for more interviews.
Interview Questions: Very annoying questions

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. Completed the application online, a couple weeks later scheduled a phone interview. After passing the phone interview, I had two face to face interview. The questions were the normal interview questions. Really simple and to the point. I was then offered the position via phone a week later.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths>

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 phone interviews for 2 other positions. I did not get either job. Then I was called for a third position, but didn't have to repeat the phone interview. I interviewed with the nurse manager and assistant nurse manager at the same time. The interview lasted about 20 minutes, including the tour of the unit. 10 minutes worth of discussing my resume and answering questions and 10 minutes for the tour. There were about 5-6 questions, very straight-forward questions.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you went above and beyond for a patient or customer. 

Describe a time you needed help with your duties. How did you approach the situation?

Describe a time you had to deal with a problem at work. How did you handle it?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call back in 1 week. Panel interview with multiple departments hiring. Be prepared to be there 2-3 hours. It is more like a formal conversations with doctors and nurses in various departments to see if you are a fit to join their team. It was not nerve racking at all, just be yourself.
Interview Questions:
Why did you become a nurse?
Do you like to work in teams?
Name a time u had a difficult patient and how did you handle the situation? 
Tell me about yourself?
One thing you would change about yourself?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got email to schedule online.  Easy to use scheduling, very good communication with HR person. Had Initial phone interview.  It was very casual, the person was friendly and not pushy at all.  it was short, approximately twenty minutes. Standard interview questions, no curve balls or scenario questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Independence, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application I was contacted about a week later to schedule a 30 minute phone interview. The phone interview was very brief, they asked questions about previous work experiences and behavioral questions. The phone interview only lasted about 10 minutes. At the end of the call the recruiter wanted to schedule an in person interview. The in person interview took place about two weeks later. I was interviewed by two groups of people, they asked the same questions, basically just going through work history and a few behavioral questions as well. Once that was finished they had me shadow one of the Account Representatives so I could see the job first hand. After that I was told that HR would contact me in a few weeks with their decision. The in person interview and shadowing took about an hour and a half. It has been over 3 weeks since the interview and I am waiting to hear back - on the website it says my application is under review. The interviews were not difficult but the hiring process sure does take a long time.
Interview Questions: What do you consider to be your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was extremely rushed, with little consideration of applicant schedules. The first round was in-person, with a case question at the end. Applicants were contacted less than 24 hours before the second round, which was conducted with two people through a video interview. When asked about the short turn-around time, the response was: "Well, that's the Cleveland Clinic way!"
Interview Questions: Why Cleveland Clinic?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Long interview process. I was called in at 2:30 and I didn't leave until 5:45pm. After the round table with about 8 nurse managers from different departments, they kindly asked if I had the day available and we proceeded on going to different departments and I was being interviewed by different staff members - from office staff and RN's to several doctors.
Their reasoning is that it is such a small group and a well oiled machine that they should make sure that I would be a perfect fit for the Team.
Then I was asked in once more yesterday, for another shorter interview within one department...still waiting to hear a decision, about 2 weeks into the process.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weakness. Be prepared to have a very detailed interview but see it more like an informal conversation where not a nursing will be asked but more like life choices and moral decisions.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview and then came in for a day to shadow patient care for 4 hours and interview with the director and manager.  It seemed pretty straight forward.
Interview Questions: How do you define professional behavior?

title: Continuous Improvement Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy and Simple. If gone through a direct hiring manager it becomes simple otherwise can be a little hassle. Had a direct interview with the hiring manager and he liked my skill set and wanted me to join his team
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: ADHD Group Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview required a one in-person interview that was quite similar to most other job requirements. Questions revolved around scenario and previous work experience that could relate to this position.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience that could help you with this position?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Current CCF employees apply online. You are then contacted by a CCF recruiter for a quick 15-30 min chat to give you info about the position requirements and job description along with hours worked and facility/institutes that positions are open. Also give you information about pay scale. They find a job for you and set up an interview with the manager. In person interview with manager and then the recruiter contacts for follow up offer or decline. They will negotiate pay for you if you so desire.
Interview Questions: Asked me about strengths and weaknesses. General facts about myself.

title: Ebi Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First round was with HR over the phone for 30 minutes with brief introduction to the company followed by behavioural questions supposed to answer in STAR format.
Next week phone interview with hiring manager and lead for 50 minutes. - Fully technical and few behavioural questions. Asked me in detail about my work experience and projects. They try to test you regarding the projects - like were you really involved in…
Interview Questions: Retrieve TOP second slary from employee table

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional in a friendly manner. Had a phone interview and after that was invited to the interview with managers. Everybody was very friendly and it was an easy interview. still waiting for results.
Interview Questions: behaviour

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Independence, OH) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call interview that went very well and the recruiter seemed excited for me to come out to interview.  The drive took me an hour and the interview less than 20 minutes rather than the hour and half as scheduled.  I was seen by two groups of three people who asked me the same exact 4 questions and than I was escorted out of the building.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: 2 different phone calls to begin with. Mostly a weeding out process. The first phone call consists of very general questions. Second phone call becomes more specific. One in person one on one interview, then a team interview. After the team interview, one more phone call to offer the job.
Interview Questions: What are my weaknesses

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Completed a phone interview, about a week later someone from the office called and left a message they wanted to do an inperson interview. I was also sent a ProveIt skills test and scored 96% during the week following the phone interview. I returned the phone call about the inperson interview later that day but never heard back from anyone.
Interview Questions: Calendar management, how knowledgeable of MS Office

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Experience questions; current studies, what makes me stand out from the rest of the candidates. Asked about why I was applying for the position.  Also asked where did I see myself in 3 - 5 years.
Interview Questions: How long have you been doing research

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Horrible experience, was asked to leave my example sheets from my previous work and was interviewed for 1.5hrs. Two days later got the automatic reply telling me I was not chosen.
Interview Questions: What would you do if I offered the role to you?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Mayfield Heights, Cuyahoga, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly simple. I applied online and a few weeks later I got a email to schedule a phone interview for the next day. Just asked basic questions about strengths and weaknesses, she then submitted my info to the hiring manager, then got a call a week later for a face to face interview with a nurse manager and PSR. I was pretty nervous until I left the interview realizing they did not ask me any questions because we laughed and toured the building and they basically told me what the job consists of. That interview was a week ago so I'm still waiting to hear something back.
Interview Questions: Name a time to was in a stressful situation, and tell me how did you overcome it?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Willoughby, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: First there's a phone interview, after waiting no response for 6-8 weeks, then  there's an in person interview , on that same day or a week or two later you shadow with someone in department you've interviewed  for, then there's another in person interview and after all of that you still don't know until 2 weeks or more later if you have the job or not
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a  co- worker; what happened and how did you handle it? What was the result of it?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, In-person interview with management, peer interview, interview with department head. The process took a long time and I had difficulty getting responses back after each step of the interview.
Interview Questions: Are you ok with this position having no patient contact.

title: Healthcare Interpretor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews and met 6 or 7 staffs including department director, It was a part time job and required a flexible time, I just moved to the US and didn't even have a car at that time, they obviously liked my previous work experience but seemed they were worried about the transportation, I think I will try again for this position.
Interview Questions: What's the most diversity work environment you had in the past?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had absolutely no patient care experience or training, only a bachelors degree in public health/pre-med. I got a phone interview with questions dealing with my strengths and exceeding expectations in my previous volunteer and work experiences. I got invited to a face to face interview the following week. I had an easy in person interview with about 7 questions, lasting for 30 mins, then shadowed a PCNA for an hour.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw a patient trying to get out of bed?

title: Acct Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Independence, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied and received an email to schedule an appointment for an interview the next day. When making the appointment the closest interview date was over 3 weeks away. I scheduled and waited patiently. When I had my interview, it was supposed to take 30 minutes but only lasted 8. She asked me a few questions and most of those were questions I answered on my application like "Do you smoke"? She then finished her questions and when I tried to ask my questions at the end, she stated that she could not answer any of those but the hiring manager could and rushed me off the phone. That was the end of the process.
Interview Questions: Do you smoke cigarettes?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator JIC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: This was for a Job Interest Community, so the phone interview lasted 20 minutes and they asked me the same questions as I already answered in the application process. They discussed pay grade and salary, which was a question I had never been asked in a preliminary interview before. They then asked a few basic questions about my work experience and told me that they would send their notes along with my resume to an actual hiring manager. This was more of an extended application process than an interview, but was helpful to my job search.
Interview Questions:
Q: Have you ever been convicted of a felony?
Q: Would you submit to a drug and tobacco test and be willing to get a flu shot?

title: Non Certified Surgical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: by phone for 1st interview, Basic questions, information gathering, why would I choose the CCF, name a stressful situation, how did you react, what was outcome, briefly tell me about a process in your work from start to finish. Tell me about 2 strengths that you feel you have that many apply to the position you are applying for.
Interview Questions: How can the Cleveland Clinic expect to hire quality candidates offering 14 per hour?

title: PAS Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Typical questions about why i was a good fit and questions about specific experiences like describe a time you facex diversity. I had 5 questions with one group and then a second interview with two more people
Interview Questions: Describe a time you faced criticism

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Lets start with my first interview, back in feb came down with the flu called and asked if I could reschedule to be told to bad you dont show up for an interview your not getting hired.  That just set the tone for this dysfunctional company. Then I interviewed with fairview, main and lakewood Cleveland clinic to only be told somehow I got lost in the mix when the recruiter called me and told me now nothing is available and just look at as it is not for me. Huh??? Who says that!

I went to school and graduated top of my class to be run around by a disorganized system. Cleveland clinic hires from a outsourcing company for phlebotomy but doesn't want to hire candidates that apply on there site...makes no sense.
Interview Questions: They base there questions on medical questions when doing interviews

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Columbus, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Informative. Gave perks of working for the clinic. Asked me what I was looking for.  Asked me back to "shadow" to see if it was a good fit for me..
Interview Questions: What was I looking for.

title: Ebi Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: it has two rounds. Started with Hr and asked behavioral questions, person details and experience you had on each one. Then face to face interview. manger lead ,snr developer was on the panel. Gave a brief description bout company and tools which they use Mostly technical interview
Interview Questions: polymorphism

title: Surgical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview.  Behavior based questions that I didn't expect to answer for surgical Tech. They didn't ask about the company surprisingly. The questions didn't add up to the position I apply for. After phone it would been a panel interview. I must say I already had previously experience that why I got the interview. But I didn't know it was going to be that difficult. I study too and was totally throwing off guard.
Interview Questions:
What something you take pride in ?
Your greatest accomplishment?
One time your provide excellent customer service

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted by email nurse recruiter the next day. Set up an initial phone screening interview with nurse recruiter, which was very casual. Interviewed with two managers of intensive care units. Both the recruiter and managers went out of their way to make me feel confident and comfortable. They also allowed time to ask them questions and were very helpful in their answers.
Interview Questions: Why Cleaveland Clinic?

title: PAS Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Independence, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, but very long. Interview was really quick, behavioral questions, and why I wanted to work at Cleveland Clinic and why I'd be a good fit. They strung it out for over a month, including drug testing, orientation as well as getting my badge.
Interview Questions: describe a time when you held a leadership position

title: Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an in person meeting with the laboratory head. It was a position in the research institute so it wasn't a clinical setting.  It was a very small lab and I was taken around and introduced to the other team members who were each able to briefly chat with me about my previous lab work.
Interview Questions: Career goals, previous experience familiarity with the techniques used in the lab.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Independence, OH) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: fast, easy, more of a general conversation, basically what you to talk about your work history, interview lasted no more than 15 minutes. you are interviewed by one of the current supervisors on the floor
Interview Questions: how much customer service experience do you have

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Well I applied for this position awhile ago. So when I got the call for interview I didn't even remember when I applied. Than I asked and it was for Cleveland clinic.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was in a movie who would have play me.

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: First was a simple phone interview, these are super easy. This is the first stage, and I imagine most people make it through this part easy. If you pass, you are scheduled for an interview with the manager of the unit you applied for. Every manager is different, some more easy and chill than others. The hardest part is the wait after the 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work on this unit?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Abrupt and poor communication. It is one thing to not get a call back and it's obvious there is not much communication among the recruiters. There is a lot of room for improving the candidate experience.
Interview Questions: Situational

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Average interview. In order to get the job RN needs to pass endurance and PBDS test. They show you a video of a situation and some data and you have to give a diagnosis, interventions and rationale. Most people have to retest.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite food? Why?

title: Pulmonary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions:
Excellent, they treat candidates very well and go above and beyond to accommodate them
Interview experience was great. Excellent, they treat candidates very well and go above and beyond to accommodate them
Interview experience was great.
Interview Questions: Career goals

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was 2 parts. First there is a phone interview which asks you behavioral questions. If you pass this then you are asked to come to the clinic for an in person interview. You meet with the nurse manager and the nurse supervisor. The interview is about 30 minutes and then you will shadow a PCNA and then here back from them within a week.
Interview Questions: While on round you find one of your patients has a temperature how can you (as a PCNA) what should you do?

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
