Short phone call with recruiter to figure out where I would best, discussed hourly pay, scheduling. A few general interview questions - a time when you handled conflict, time when you had to act quick...things like that. In person interview was with 2 nurse managers, their questions were still very general and they gave me more of the job description (I had experience with patient care) so we discussed that. Afterwards you’re given an opportunity to shadow the unit (stay for at least 30 minutes to an hour) then you wait for your phone call. My manager went on vacation after my interview so my process after was slightly different and longer because of that.

I will tell you that once you get the job there is a fitness like test, it’s a resistance chair to test your strength. It’s tricky and I thought I failed because the harder you push the harder it pushes back. My best advice is to literally give it your all.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work in healthcare?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pre-screening interview with HR. They were very warm and friendly. Mostly logistical questions and a description of the hiring process. They discussed salary data as well as potential scheduling options. They made it very clear that their entire campus is a nicotine free campus. After the initial screening interview, they send your application to the hiring manager of the department that you requested.
Interview Questions: Q: why do you want to work here?

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview process began with a phone interview, a one-on-one with hiring manager, and shadowing and meeting your potential peers. Responses should be a prepared script summary of your work history using some of the actual job description which you are applying.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to go above and beyond your job responsibilities?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (New Haven, CT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is basically a phone interview, started with some basic questions like self-introduction, then based on my resume they asked some questions, and they talked about the biostatistician position, at last they asked me whether I have any questions for them.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your background, and what positions are you interested in?

title: Clinical Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It went well until I disclose that I do live and work in the Bahamas and will need sponsorship to be employed in the U.S. The interviewer briefed me what the daily duties will be and the reason for the organization creating this position.
Interview Questions: Reason for choosing Clinical System Analyst

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Asked lots of behavioral interview questions and had current interns ask the questions. That may make it more intimidating for some people. There are some people who enjoy working there but it's clear others really do not.
Interview Questions: Tell me About a time when you had conflict

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Cleveland Clinic's website, I got a phone screening invitation from a hiring manager. After my brief phone conversation with the hiring manager, I was invited for a group phone interview.  The group phone interview was very technical: there were simple applied statistics questions and study design questions. The phone calls were about 1:30 minutes long.
Interview Questions:
Vague memory: researchers want to study the effect of certain treatment in two treated patient populations (group A and group B) at Cleveland Clinic, what analysis methods should be used? 

Other questions a long this line.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process took about two months from the time they called to the time I got hired.  I personally think this is way too long especially because it took them over a month to call me after the interview.  I thought I wasn't going to get hired at that time.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Clinical Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: They have a simple vetting process. Your first interview will be through HR which consists of standard interview questions. Once you get through the first phase your next interview will be with the department manager whom is hiring. Sometimes that may be with a panel or just one individual. Very standard interview process. They don't throw any curve balls with the questions.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have with...

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Warrensville Heights, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: First you receive a call informing you that the manager is interested in interviewing and they make arrangements for you to set up your phone interview. If they are interested, before you get off the phone the rep. Schedule a face to face interview with you.
Interview Questions: What make you think you are a good fit for this job?

title: Quality Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two weeks after applying, I received a phone screen invite. I later found out the position was no longer available, and the phone screen did not take place. The recruiter was pleasant, though, in delivering this news.
Interview Questions: None

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied with veterans preference. I think that's the only reason I got a call back. First I interviewed with the nurse manager after 2 weeks she called to set-up a staff interview and shadowing. I interviewed with 3 other employees(a couple nurses and a health unit coordinator) then I shadowed for a while. I was a little nervous at first but everyone was nice and not intimidating at all. Everything seemed good but 2 weeks later I got the dreaded email that they decided to pursue other candidates.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a conflict with an employee

title: Applicant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Long, drawn out. Multiple one on one and group interviews. Poor communication. Interviewer stiff and not friendly. Many, many personal questions. Not sure they were all relevant. Interviewer unable to identify core competencies about the role. Hinted at my age a couple of times.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Biomedical Equipment Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
It was basically a phone interview with the manager and a the lead technician. They asked me a few questions about my experience with biomedical equipment. I had my BSME at the time and was looking to broaden my horizons. All they did was laugh at me for not having biomedical equipment experience and told me the position was only going to be $9.50 hr. starting out doing shadowing and that I had to relocate to Cleveland If I wanted the job.  

Why would I spend money and time for a high school paid position? Plus spend more money on relocation for it? In the end I turned them down and never sought after employment from them again.
Interview Questions:
How many years of experience do you have with biomedical equipment repair?
Are you willing to do the work for a little above min. wage?
Are you willing to relocate for min wage?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Two weeks later, they called from the first interview. They asked some simple questions. It was nice. That was a week ago. Now, I'm just waiting for a call back- hiring me or rejecting me. Then, I'll know if I have go back for a drug test and background check. Also, HR let me know that the hiring process is little long.
Interview Questions: Why did I like my last job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy! Interview process can drag on with up to 3 interviews, presentations, and skills testing, phone interview, 1 on 1 interview, and group panel interview. Also have to do drug screening and PE. Department and HR drag their feet during the process. Hard to get a quick response as neither is good at returning phone calls or emails.
Interview Questions: 1 on 1 General not tough. Interviewers sometimes do not seem to know what to ask, or how to respond to your questions. Group panel consists of people in the department you are interviewing with questions are not prepared and random.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: This review is for the Lou Ruvo location in Las Vegas, NV. I don't even know where to begin. I initially applied for a Project Manager position that was posted (on Indeed). I received a call from either HR or an Admin Asst. of that department for which the position was posted. I went through several phone and in-person interviews (about 5 total). Towards the last couple of interviews, I was presented another position which was totally unexpected because the original Project Manager position had been "eliminated". Another week later and I'm informed that the alternate position is part-time. As the process moves forward, it just keeps getting worse and disorganized and then I'm informed that the new part-time position has to be posted and therefore I'd need to re-apply. Overall, very disappointed in this whole process and management needs to figure out the details before they even post jobs publicly. This is very misleading and frustrating for candidates. A lot of time taken off from current job only to be disappointed in the end.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Cleveland Clinic?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Position was for interning with the Business Operations Center in Independence, OH. Initially received an email rejection letter for the position, however, was followed up by Talent Acquisition that managers will be in contact with me soon to set up an interview. Assistants to 3 different managers emailed me to set up an interview, email was brief and did not include details of position. Each phone interview lasted about 30 minutes and asked typical questions (how does your experiences align with the position, tell me about yourself, what is your career path). However, phone interviews were placed on speaker and hard to hear - it was difficult to pick out and retain what each different position entailed. Managers said I should hear from HR at the end of the week. Did not hear back from anyone for about 2 weeks then managers themselves emailed me to notify I was selected (HR department was not doing their job and seems disconnected).
Interview Questions: What is your career path

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a 10 minute interview in a room with 3 Cleveland Clinic finance employees, followed by a 1-hour interview with two people in my specific role a few weeks later, phone screening (was supposed to be the first step but it was done after the other two interviews).  The 10-minute interview felt very fast, and it was hard to say everything I wanted to in that time.  The 1-hour interview was a lot more relaxed and closer to what I am used to in interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work with people from several different areas/backgrounds.

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from a recruiter and scheduled an face to face interview. The day of the interview I talked with the floor manager, then I shadowed with another CT and that was very interesting and everyone on the floor was very nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: What made me wanna apply for this unit and this position.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying online there was a telephone interview with a recruiter. If everything went well with that they sent your information to the hiring manager of the unit. They decide if they want a one on one interview. During the interview with the manager they may let you shadow a nurse. It took about a week to get the job offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when...

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Process took ab 5 weeks. First was a phone interview then a panel interview with 3 people, showed me around the facility. Took two weeks to tell me I wasnt offered the job
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in a year?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. The process took one month. I interviewed at  Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland Ohio).
Phone interview took 30 minutes, just some basic questions to know your background and some STAR questions. Onsite  interview took couple hours, I met the team and answered several behavior quesitons
Interview Questions: Walk through resume, Basic STAR questions.

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Great Interview Process. Group Interview and then individual interviews with the managers. Provide examples of applications submitted and agencies. Must have experiences with federal awards and foundations. They usually move fast with the hiring process so be ready to move quickly. Great experience and would encourage people to apply.
Interview Questions: What is your experience?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty brief, normal behavioral questions on rphone with a recruiter. About 30 mins of my time. Hiring took two weeks for me, guess they were really in need of some one. I know the process can take months sometimes but i was lucky.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a work conflict?

title: Host Family for International Doctors Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online form to fill out and a home visit to make sure the living conditions were appropriate for the doctors to live in and to see where the home is located.
Interview Questions: How many people are living in  the home and what amenities the home offers.

title: Administrative Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Westlake, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Fine. I double majored with a good GPA and everyone is different. For me, it was no problem seeing they were seriously considering me. In hindsight, my biggest weakness is I did not see they were a sham.
Interview Questions: Biggest Weaknesses.

title: Speech Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Process took several weeks, but overall pleasant experience. I chose to wait for a response before applying to other jobs. Length of process could deter some if needing a job more quickly.
Interview Questions: General questions about self, experience in the field, and employment questions.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online assessment, phone interview, sit-down interview.  A lot of rapid-fire questions and questions that were behavior-based.  Make sure you prepare for the interview by reading how about STAR.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 -year plan?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online got a phone interview the next week. Phone interview consisted of the basic questions why do you think youre a good fit for this position? Tell me your strengths. Where do you see yourself in 5 years? How long do you olan to stay in this position if its offered to u?
Interview Questions: Describe a time when u had to deal with a difficult patient and how did u handle it

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I've had three interviews at CCF, all in lab medicine and all jobs I was hired for. The process varies from department to department. The first lab tech position I interviewed for was extremely quick from the time I applied to my start date. The other two were each  dragged out over two months.
Interview Questions:
I was asked many of the same questions,

Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

What are your career and educational goals?

Think of a time you were faced with a difficult situation,  how did you handle it?

title: Continuous Improvement Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions mainly. Employer wanted to understand the working behavior and the way we can adopt to the culture and if we have the drive to work in a challenging environment
Interview Questions: One conflicting previous experience with management and How I tackled the situation

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a one on one interview with the Nurse Manager. They wanted to know about the experience I've had up to that point and the things I've seen and the patients I've taken care of thus far. Also, clinical based "What would you do" questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a specific clinical situation? How would you respond?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone interview. The questions asked were first general interview questions, followed by a few job specific questions. Overall it was a average interview nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to work with a group of people with different view points, how did you handle it

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Lakewood, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy, normal questions 
Took about a week to hear from hr. 
Manager was very nice and even answered questions after the interview.
Very straight forward on what they are looking for 
The worst is the scheduling of appointments and coordinating for a start date
Interview Questions: What was your most difficult situation with another employee and how did u handle the situation

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: just showing your method of blood collection. how you handle yourself. also knowing what to do especially when it comes down to making sure you know the order of draw and taking the tourniquet off before 60 secs.
Interview Questions: how long have you done this for about how many patients have you delt with within 8 hour are you free to work weekends?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Lorain, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: They did a phone interview first. Once they decided that they wanted to meet with you they would call you a couple days later to set up a date. Then they would have you shadow there department.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in this position?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, FL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for personal interview and asked questions pertaining to my past experience and work ethic. I was also asked to describe personal views about myself andf past experience
Interview Questions: My experience as a phlebotomist, dependability, flexibility, work hours

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: intense multi-level process with one on one per Hr followed by two separate interviews with panels of various levels of management.  A scripted interview was performed and time was allotted for free-text questions and also questions posed about current staff and their position status or intention to stay with the company
Interview Questions: What one thing can you think of that you did to help your team improve

title: Quality Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The person interviewing was more interested in talking about themselves and how they moved up the chain.  Was very difficult to get a word in so I wanted the interview to end anyways.  I'm really glad I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: What are your weakness?

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Most correspondence was via e-mail.  The initial phone screen was by a call-center person who asked STAR questions and took notes.  She had no legal background and my answers had to be kept simple. The first interviewer told me that a portion of the job description had changed to an area where I had no experience, so I figured I was no longer a serious candidate.  But I still interviewed with 5 groups of two or three people which was very confusing since no one brought business cards with them.   My pre-interview request for the names of those I would interview with went unanswered, so I had no idea what to expect.  Paralegals and support staff were  included in the decision-making process, which was nice.  Everyone was laid-back and friendly.  Some were chatty, some asked direct questions, some asked STAR questions--I got a little bit of everything.  Their reference check is all automated and you send out the emails, making me suspect that they check references on more than just their top candidates. The rejection letter was a form e-mail from Talent Management.
Interview Questions: Basic STAR questions.

title: Staf RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short interview, basic questions. Main focus is on team work. Was a small panel interview, consisted of four nurses in the room The interview also consisted of scenario questions. Was asked how a difficult situation was handled. Also asked about a time where I went above and beyond for a patient.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about team work?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by an HR representative as part of the screening process. Then, I was sent to interview with the Nurse Manager, Assistant Nurse Manager and Charge Nurse for a New Grad RN Program in a medical-surgical unit.
Interview Questions: Tell us about one time you had to deal with a difficult patient and how the situation was resolved. How do you see yourself in the next 5 years? Tell us about a time you went above and beyond the call of duty for a patient.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It takes forever from your first interview to your actual start date.
You'll receive an email to set up a phone interview.  After that you'll come in for an interview with the department managers of the position your applying for. 
After this is may take a month or two to be offered the job.
Interview Questions: They ask  About other companies worked for and the reason you've left other job positions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a great interview experience. Went in person after a phone interview, shadowed on 2 units and I was thoroughly impressed by the staff members, management and quality of patient care. I am a new grad and they are really invested in making you the best nurse possible. It seems like they are a really great hospital to work for.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions. Some clinical questions related to specialty.

title: Rrt Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back, basically not much at all. The guy just showed me around after we introducted each other, then I just got hired afterward. Two days later I got an email fro HR for hiring process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews met with supervisor then team, all were professional and to the point. Weeks later contacted by HR with competitive offer. Pre-screening process through awaiting completion of that. I feel very positive about working here.
Interview Questions: How soon are you available?

title: PAS Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Avon, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the application on line the next day I received an email inviting me for a phone interview for the following week.  During the phone interview she asked basic questions and then sent me a typing test later that day I received an email saying I passed the tying test and would hear something within two weeks.  I received an email 6 days later inviting me to schedule a face-to-face interview which was 2 days later.  Interview was very nice and easy to talk to.  Again basic questions asked about my current job and why I wanted to leave.  She then said I would hear something within two weeks, I received an email saying after reviewing my application they decided to pursue other candidates, never even acknowledge that I was in for a interview found that rather strange, it was if I never even interviewed.  It would of been nice to get a rejection email that actually acknowledge they spoke to me.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a disagreement  with a co-worker?

title: Nurse Resident RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was a phone interview. They reviewed my resume and asked me questions about my past experience, school, and clinical. The interviewer was very upbeat and straight forward. She explained what would be expected of the position and went over preferences on location, shift, and status (full time, part time, prn). She also explained what to expect if hired on.
Interview Questions: Tell me two personal strengths that would help you in the nursing field. Tell me a time you went above and beyond for a patient. How do you handle conflict in the workplace.

title: Physician Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process began with online application and then online test, phone call from Human Resources and then Multiple In-Person interview; one with Director of IT , Chief Information Officer, Department Manager and one peer.
Interview Questions: I see this resume. Tell me something about yourself that I won't find here in your resume.

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I applied online. Within a week I got a phone call from an recruiter letting me know I have interview. I did one phone interview, then I was called in person for a interview with the manager. I was then asked references then I accepted the job offer.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an unhappy patient?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to meet with a workleader and a manager for a part time position months after applying. Both were extremely nice, informative of the position and eager to bring new people into the work environment.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're a good fit for the role?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1st week Manager Interview then 2nd interview doctor and director interview manager interview went food got called for 2nd interview a week later then met with doctor and director but when i showed up it was another candidate there at the same time preparing to be interviewed as well. its been a week still waiting to hear back
Interview Questions: typical interview questions

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Akron, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview. Then I was invited to come in and interview with the manager the following week. it was one on one with the manager. I was given a tour around the department and introduced to the supervisors as well.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself? what are your strengths and weaknesses? why do want to work here?

title: PAS Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a set time that was scheduled. They called me right on time. After the interview was over they said I would be hearing from them in the next week. Three weeks went by and I had to call them myself because they did not let me know either way like they said they would.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the Cleveland Clinic?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a recruiter in person. Basic questions - why cleveland clinic? When did you go above and beyond for a patient? How do you manage stress?  Resolve conflict. Nonthreatenimg  and went very smoothly. From there I was scheduled for an interview with the nurse manager, and was asked to wear scrubs so I could tour. My in person interview is scheduled for this week.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process took about 3+ weeks. I applied online then got a call from a nurse recruiter. She did a brief easy phone interview then scheduled an in-person interview on the unit. The first half of the interview process included meeting with the nurse recruiter, nurse educator and nurse manager. They were friendly asked behavioral and scenario type questions. Then that part was concluded and I was told that I was to meet with two other nurses (peer interview). I was then grilled again. After that I was taken on a tour of the unit. Then that was it.
Interview Questions: When did you go above and beyond for a patient?

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Standard Interview. They showed me around the lab, and introduced me to the lab members. They then assessed my knowledge of the research they were doing, to make sure I knew what the lab was about. They then asked background-based questions, using my CV as a jumping off point for this.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 10 years?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked to schedule an interview last Thursday. We set it up for the following Friday, and I was told that I would receive an email with confirmation and directions. I never received it, so Wednesday, I called and left a voicemail to confirm my email address. I never heard back, so called again today (Thursday, day before), and had to leave another message. 

She finally returned my call this afternoon, and left a voicemail saying that the interview was canceled because they decided to offer the job to an internal candidate. 

1. I took off work for this interview that never happened. 
2. I was never called letting me know it was canceled. So I'm wondering, had I not called, would they have called me? I would've driven down there and shown up for nothing. 

It was very unprofessional the way it was handled and I'm very disappointed. I now have an afternoon off work that I don't need. I asked a few coworkers to use them as references and a midwife wrote me a recommendation letter. I prepared a lot for this.... I don't think I will apply for CCF again.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I've applied for two positions from different departments. After about 2-3 weeks, I got one initial interview from an assigned recruiter and the other from the statistical group,after submitting several documents.
Interview Questions: 1. What is your strength and weakness? 2. How you perform on a team work when there is a conflict? 3. What make you think you would be a best fit  in this position? 4. how you describe slope parameter in logistic regression? 5. have you learnt/used bayesian before? 6.  have you worked on predictive model before?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was located in another state when I applied for an RN position. The first interview was with an HR representative over the phone and included roughly 5 scenario based questions. I was then invited for an in-person interview and shadowing on the unit. If the shadowing experience is successful, you then are required to complete a drug test, physical/fitness test, and PBDS & drug math examination to test your knowledge base and competency.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed back to interview in person. The interviewer was fairly conceited, I didn't think she represented the company well. I think it's a great company with a reputation of being prissy and she did not help that, but I was able to meet others in the department that I really enjoyed and could see myself working with that helped.
Interview Questions: Where did you go to school and what is your hospital social work experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Nurse Manager on the unit first and toured the unit with him. I then interviewed with 2 Charge Nurses and 2 staff Nurses finally. Overall, I was there for about 2 hours.
Interview Questions:
Why Cleveland Clinic?
3 words to describe your personality
Behavioral type questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: This process was a phone interview to move onto a one-on-one interview. It was scheduled through an online process. The recruiter was very friendly. It was not as intimidating as I had thought it would be. It is important to be prepared for this interview although it is a phone interview. Specific examples from previous work and clinicals are expected to be prepared.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions and behavioral questions

title: Phlebotomy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, they asked a multitude of questions and said they would get back to me. Haven't heard back yet, but Cleveland Clinic takes about a month to get back to you.
Interview Questions: They asked if I complied with the drug and smoke free atmosphere

title: Patient Services Reresentative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (West Palm Beach, FL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was with 4 different people in different positions that interact with the position I was interviewing for. One was an equal peer, the next a supervisor, then a nurse and finally a DON.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you bring to the position?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The in person interviews are cool and all, but the online requirements are brutally tedious.  I am considering writing a complaint telling how much it pained me to do the tasks.  Not hard, but demeaningly annoying.
Interview Questions: Just stuff about my resume

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Beechwood, Stark, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview went in phases. Step one watch videos and explanation of Cleveland clinic and RN internship program. Step two group interview it was one on one but you're sitting next to a bunch of others interviewing, from there they fit you with your best choice of hospital and area of interest. You set up an interview with the manager of that location and a shadow experience. My favorite part was the shadow experience. This seems like a fantastic company and great place to continue learning as a new RN.
Interview Questions: A time a made a difference and went above and beyond for a patient

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quite easy, straightforward questions, interviewers were good, though some looked disinterested and just did their job. Overall it was a seamless process, easier than any other interviews I have had.
Interview Questions: Strengths

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got an email a week after applying with some interview times, I picked one and they called and we talked about my previous work experience, after that they asked what shift and what kind of schedule and which location I prefer to place me. Then I got an email asking for 5 references that had to respond to a survey about me within 24 hours (via email). Then I met with my potential nurse manager, THEN had to go through drug/fitness testing at one of their locations, THEN got the offer. The whole experience took about a month!
Interview Questions: Name a time where you worked as a team

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a recruiter over the phone and then was connected with the nurse manager of the unit. Since I was out of state, I spoke with the nurse manager over the phone. After I shadowed on the unit I was then hired.
Interview Questions: Nurse manager asked me to name 2 of my strengths?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website and got an email within a day or two to schedule a phone interview.  The recruiter called me on time and I was asked questions about how I handled different situations.  From there, I got a call maybe a week or so later to interview with a nurse manager.  I shadowed on the floor with a PCNA for a little while and then met with the manager.  She mostly talked to me about work expectations.  The only question she asked me was, "How do you handle stress?"  I was told after the interview that she would be offering me a position.  I got my call for HR within a few days of my interview.  Overall, the process was lengthy, but not difficult.  Once you get an offer, you have to do a physical, drug test, and orientation.  You are paid for your time at orientation, which is great.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral/scenario questions.  One was along the lines of "Tell me about a time you were in a difficult situation."  Another had to deal with patient care and how I went above and beyond for someone.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with Physician in charge of research. Series of questions about my qualifications, previous research,  soft skills, hard skills, passion about healthcare and the research in questions. Much more relaxed because this was an unpaid position.
Interview Questions: Why Urological research? Why the Cleveland Clinic?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and later that day I received an email to schedule a phone interview. Phone interview was set up for 2 days later. At the end of the phone interview I was offered 3 face to face interview options. I scheduled 2 interviews for the following week. Face to face interview was casual and more of an overview of the position and floor. Followed an employee around for 20 min. Was offered and accepted position 2 days later.
Interview Questions: Name one situation from your previous work experience or clinical experience where you went above and beyond for a patient or customer.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received an email regarding setting up an initial phone interview literally the next day. Phone interview lasted roughly 30-40 min and consisted of some basic behavioral questions and some background information regarding the position. 

Next step was an in person interview. Was interviewed by two supervisors. The questions were very basic behavioral questions once again. Shortly after the first interview the hiring manager also interviewed me and asked more personality based questions like "What one trait could you bring to the workplace that may not be currently present?" 

One week later received a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time that you made a decision too quickly and there was a negative outcome. What happened and how did you fix the issue?

title: Customer Service Billing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Received email to schedule phone interview. After phone interview was advised that I would receive either phone call or email. Received email invite for face to face interview. After face to face interview received offer by phone within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Customer Service related questions and how you would be able to show compassion to the patients.

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: i submitted an application through one of my friends who was working at the same hospital for the past 2 years and was willing to put in a good word for me and spoke to the head of the department regarding my willingness to work there. I communicated with them on email and submitted my documents  and I was called for an interview with the program director
Interview Questions: my qualifications

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Was interview at a hiring event, about 100+ people in the building at the time. Sat with a HR rep, went over my initial application, then proceeded to schedule multiple interviews with several hiring managers at the hospitals I was interested in. About a week later interviewed with floor managers.
Interview Questions: name one time you dealt with a difficult patient or family.

title: Patient Care Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with Nurse Manager on the floor in which I was hired, lasted about 20 minutes.  Then she showed me around the floor and introduced me to a current PCNA to ask questions and "hang out" with for about 10 minutes.  After you accept the position, you go through CC's training, which lasts about 3 weeks M-TH business hours (paid), a 4 hour BLS certification class (paid), and CC orientation in Beachwood for 3 days (paid).  There is a urine drug and nicotine screen with an employee present, as well as blood drawn and a TB test.  Then, you orient with a current PCNA full 12 hour shifts for about 5 weeks.
Interview Questions:
How do you feel that you can make a patient's stay at the hospital better?
How do you feel you can uphold the Cleveland Clinic's Patient First mentality?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Charlottesville, VA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I work in Lerner Research Institute of cleveland clinic foundation (CCF). They gave a typical interview such as skpe for postdoc in biology field. I think it is dependent on lab or PI at least in postdoctoral research fellow position. nothing special
Interview Questions: How long would you like to work in the lab?

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: EASY interview, training, hired within less than a month has seen an add in the lobby of the hospital when visiting my baby in the nick u , I applied and was called shortly there after. I took a class on the computer system that was used. and then trained on the skills and then on the floor.
Interview Questions: the reason why I wanted to become a nursing assistant was really the only main question.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very formal interview. I was asked to present my research program with not particular interest given to the scientific interest I had. No empathy at all. Robotic people thinking and acting like machines. Or if you want more like actors reading a script. Everybody was so cold during the interview and employment process that I felt very disappointed about my decision to accept an offer at Cleveland Clinic. The employment office also did several mistakes related to my data entry in the internal system. I also realized that the majority of employees I was seeing around were not happy to work there and in fact I could experience a significance unhappiness a few months later.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I originally had no caregiving experience so I was real nervous but when I went to the Job fair I felt like the only qualified candidate had to take a math and English test before I had my first set of interviews. then had a second interview at hospital with job shadowing on another day. Went real good. Once hired has to do 2 1/2 week training course.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted by phone a week later.Very friendly.Asked to come in for an interview 2 days later,gave me time to prepare.Office was very nice,all of he staff were very friendly.I sat and spoke with the head nurse and the person who originally contacted me.It felt more like a normal conversation with friends,than a nerve racking interview.Was shown around the office and then all of us went and spoke with the Dr. I would be working with.Overall experience and process was very good.
Interview Questions: Mostly just discussed how the office worked and I explained in more detail my past experience.Did I feel comfortable working in certain situations? How would I handle certain types of patients?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview - standard behavior based questions
Then you're entered into a pool where if a Nurse Manager thinks you're a good fit, you'll get called to shadow and interview on a unit.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a difficult patient

title: Med-Surg Telemetry Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online application, then a follow-up e-mail with an in-person interview date and time. During that interview, one recruiter reviewed my application and resume and asked general questions, including areas of interest. Then, she set me up with two interviews with the Nurse Managers of the units that were hiring.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were scenario-based questions, ie: Tell me about an experience you had with a difficult patient. How did you handle it? And what did you do?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty standard initial phone interview. The person asked general questions that you would get asked at any job interview. The phone call lasted about 20 minutes. A followup interview would be scheduled if the party like your application.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in the position.

title: Contract Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Supervisor who first outlined the specifics of the job and job expectations.  The supervisor and then asked a few questions.  Then I met with other staff who also provided more information and asked a few more questions.  It was a comfortable and informal interview but the interviewers did ask some challenging questions.
Interview Questions: If an emergency arose during the first few days of employment and your immediate supervisor was off-site and unavailable, what would you do?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Madison, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Filled out the application from indeed.com received an email about setting up a phone interview. Phone interview lasted about 10 minutes then received a phone call to set up a face to face interview. Face to face was with 2 people, seemed positive. Told me I would hear within the week. I was never contacted either way just left in the air. Not very professional to me.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Ombudsman Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The first contacted me by email to set up a telephone screening interviewer.  That went well, and the person I spoke with was friendly and easy to talk to.  From there, I proceeded to a group interview.
Interview Questions: What was your most stressful workplace situation and how did you handle it.

title: Evs Area Cleaner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Good money great benefits and lists of opportunities to further your career Cleveland Clinic is very encouraging their courage you to become a homeowner go back to school and very flexible as far as moving to other positions that you may have went to school for already
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Cleveland Clinic what do you like about Cleveland Clinic what do you dislike about Cleveland Clinic why would you be a good candidate for this job and why wouldn't you be a good candidate for this job

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Well organized process. Sixteen applicants interviewed per day so it seemed a bit impersonal. Hotel was provided and dinner the night before. Current residents and their spouses attended and answered questions that may not have been appropriate in formal interviews. On interview day, 4-5 interviewers were scheduled in 20 minute blocks. It was difficult to get a feel for how interested they are in you but they were all very easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Appointment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The interview was partially over the phone/in person. The interview is 30 minutes long. Lots of questions but nothing too complicated. Overall the interview went well. I have no complaints
Interview Questions:
Explain a time you handled a difficult situation?

How did you and your teammates solve a difficult problem ?

How did you handle a technical problem?

title: IT Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The process was very smooth.  The interview was over the phone with 3 senior IT staff from Fairview IT.  It was very informal but professional at the same time.  I was surprised at how relaxed and friendly the Senior IT staff were.  I knew from the interview that this was a team I wanted to be a part of.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness.

title: Staff RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Beachwood, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Mass interview at Beachwood location pick morning or afternoon get a formal interview then figure out that day if getting an interview to a certain floor. I was interviewed at a table while others were interviewing at nearby tables. Sent to a room and another HR rep comes and asks you where else you would like to interview (CC location and floors available)
Interview Questions:
2 skills you have that are good for job?
Time you went above and beyond for patient and/or customer?
Time felt job was difficult?
Time you failed in life?

title: Office of Civic Education Initiatives Summer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I found out about this opportunity through a family friend. The initial application is extremely tedious: it involves a lot of paperwork that has to be put together in a very specific order. There was an online application as well that was very straightforward. I heard back a couple weeks later with an interview offer. The interview was slightly intimidating as it started off with a test that had many advanced biology, chemistry, and medical based questions (apparently your score is not taken into affect when they decide to hire you or not).  The interview was not very intimidating, it's just you and a Cleveland clinic staff member.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw a fellow intern not abiding by the dress code?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: the Interview process starts with 1. Pre-screening 2. Face to face interview 3. Shadow experience 4. Job offer 5. Physical assessment 6. if out of state, needs Ohio license. You will not receive an offer in the first step (pre-screening) telephone interview. My interviewer was very nice with a calm voice so I was not as nervous as what I thought I would be.
Interview Questions: Interviewer asked basic behavioral questions. No clinical questions.

title: Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: When I first arrived at the lab, the lab member showed me around the lab, introduced the lab and all lab members. then the boss talked to me first. then everyone in the lab talked to me about their experience in the lab and Cleveland, also their projects et al. It was very pleasant and relax procedure.
Interview Questions: What will you bring in for our current research?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Fairview Health Services are quick to respond and professional with an excellent HR and Credentialing departments. The interview was what I expected, and I felt well taken care of during the entire process. The orientation is where satisfaction on my end began to decline. There should be somewhat of a standard process for orientation within the system, and this seems to be lacking in a number of the clinics.
Interview Questions: Nothing out of the ordinary

title: Clpn Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: apparanttly the process has become extremly long and stressful also takes over a month to get hired.must be accepted by phone,then personnel,testing of skill test,mental test and than  actualon site physical regarding abilities ,finally  drug and backgrond check
Interview Questions: unable to discover how the changes affected staffing so negativly

title: Surgical Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Online application that takes around 30mins. I did not hear from them for over 3 weeks before getting called for an interview. Was hired then but had to wait a month to start.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a hostile patient?

title: RN Resident I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Brook Park, OH) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview is the initial step of the hiring process. After I applied I received an email to schedule a phone interview. They called me on scheduled day and asked me basic questions about my resume. The they asked me general questions that were more behavioral based. Once you pass phone interview they close out the position you applied for and your resume gets put in a resume bank. If any floor is looking to hire your resume gets pulled and they call you for a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an ethical dilemma you encountered while taking care of a patient during clinical

title: Med-Surg Telemetry Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: After being contacted by the nursing recruiter, I was led through the interview process by the nurse manager and several other staff members.  I was able to shadow for the position for which I was interested and many of my questions were answered directly by staff.
Interview Questions: What kind of a nurse do you want to be?

title: Internist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied on their website and passed the pre-hire assessment. Got the hiring manager's call couple days later and was scheduled an on-site interview. The process went pretty well, no unexpected questions were asked. Got the offer the day.
Interview Questions: All common interview questions.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: several interviews to get into the clinic; Questions like how did you make you previous employer more organized, How will your previous experience help you in this position, How can you improve this position?
Interview Questions: Questions about experiences

title: PAS Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Put in a app through indeed.com got a email to schedule an phone interview 2 weeks later. Once I passed the phone interview the recruiter stated she was sending me a typing test to see if I match requirements for the position which is 35 wpm. I passed the test an she emailed me the next morning letting me know she was forwarding my application to the hiring manager for that department an I should give it 2 weeks before I hear from them if they decide to move forward with a in person interview. I heard back in exactly 6 days had my face to face interview and she told me give HR 2 weeks (I think they just say 2 wks by default) I heard from another recruiter in exactly 1 week and she offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond in your pervious job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. HR emailed and set up initial phone screening with HR. Put into pool with other new graduates. About two weeks later heard from hiring manager. Phone interview scheduled and completed.
Interview Questions: All basic interview questions

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: They start with a phone interview as the initial screening, If your phone interview goes well, then they forward you information to the hiring manager. Then within a few weeks you have the face to face interview. The manager will not contact you if you are chosen, you are emailed by a talent coordinator who will let the manager know of your decision.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work weekends and holidays?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Application online, no published phone numbers to follow up application process, they have a "application status" but it is never updated. HR called 1 month later, had the interview, tour of department and interview with Nurse Manager and Clinical Coordinator. 2 months later started the job.
You have to take a Physical Competency  Test on a resistance   machine in PT. If you do not have any strength, you will not pass and offer is recinded.
Interview Questions: How do  you deal with difficult people ?

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was an internal transfer, so the process was fairly quick. Applied and about 2 weeks got a phone call for an interview. It was an interview panel of 3 managers. Questions were all pretty basic, mostly behavioral type questions. I heard back 10 days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Can you give a time where you were unclear about an objectives or your duties?

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Independence, OH) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Completed online application submitted it with resume and two days later i received a call from a recruiter who scheduled a phone interview with me. I completed the phone interview and I am waiting to hear from them for my first in-person interview.
Interview Questions:
What did you do at your previous employer (s)?
Name two skills that make you perfect for this position.
Describe a stressful situation at a previous job and how you handled it.
Describe a situation in which you turned a bad situation with a customer into a good one.
Why do you think you would be a good fit for this job?

title: Appointment Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: The process being with an application and online assessment based on personality and tasks related to the role such as filing order.  The next step is a phone interview which behavioral based.  The recruiter passed your information to a hiring manager at the site and coordinates an appointment if there is interest.  Face to face interview can vary between behavioral and spontaneous.  Generally, it consists of two-three people with one notetaker.  It is a fairly laid back organization.  As with most call centers, there are periods of two many chefs in the kitchen and lack of clarity but overall a decent company to work for.  Advancing is challenging as there are not many levels between rep and management.  In addition, a four year degree is preferred and draws a lot of competition.
Interview Questions: If you were to take an ad out in the paper what three words would you use to describe yourself?

title: Data Analyst Electronic Health Record Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR via telephone was straight forward. Discussed general overview of what IT EHR be doing on a day to day process. Also discuss compensation which is on the lower end for being in IT, exempt, and EHR which is also government funded.
Interview Questions: Discussion about compensation....Is it soon to be discussing during an initial phone interview?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant (PCNA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview and screening with HR. I they felt you were qualified they offered a 1:1 interview with the manager of the department. The manager will then have you shadow another 
pcna to give you an idea of what you will be doing if hired.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. What are some challenges you have faced in other jobs and how did you handle them.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing process was lengthy with multiple tiers of management to interview with.  Each person I met and interviewed with from human resources to team leaders to directors was nice and willing to answer any questions.  There was no feedback on what an applicant could do different to obtain the position.  Everyone was just nice and positive so it was very hard to gauge if the interview went as well as it seemed or do the interviewers always treat applicants the same regardless of whether they plan to hire them or not.  The shadowing experience is a positive in that it gives an applicant an idea of the work area they are applying for but on the other hand it can be stressful to the applicant being put on the spot in real time action without even being introduced to everyone or knowing where anything is.  It is difficult to navigate a patient down a hallway while acting like you know what you are doing when it is the first time you have been down the hallway yourself.
Interview Questions: I was asked by two members of the management team how old I was.  I did not expect to be asked about my age and felt the questioning should have been directed toward my experience and education.  The management team could have easily assessed my age by the background check or made a best guess by my resume.

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty straightforward but allowed creativity and expression of what I really felt, very informative and helpful for me to understand the position and what was required of me.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to be a pcna?

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is extensive. First it's the online application, phone/online interview, test on site, interview with hr, then interview with nurse manager. You can go through the entire process and still not get hired. The job is not officially yours until you receive an offer. They also require drug testing, physical agility testing, sizing for respirator mask, physical exam, and 2 week training before being placed on the floor.
Interview Questions: Most questions were the typical difficult questions and a lot of scenario questions such as, tell me about a time when.....? And how did you handle it?

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed by a recruiter over the phone. I then had a face to face interview with the Unit Nursing Manager and two Assistant Nursing Managers. After my interview I was given a tour of the 5 units in the MICU and sat with another Health Unit Coodinator for about an hour to see what the job was like.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work here.

title: Reimbursement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: For internal candidates it is an awful and misleading process. There is no follow up and they leave employees in limbo while waiting on the decision.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a stressful or difficult situation at work

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online app with a personality-type test. Then a phone interview with a recruiter, then in-person panel-style interview with the clinical manager and 3 others. I received an offer the same day as the in-person interview, then some more back and forth with the recruiter on final details. They are very serious about only hiring the best and they *will* make you work for it. Be prepared to jump through a lot of hoops.
Interview Questions: Typical STAR questions.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough.  Questions were pertinent.  Informative email and phone conversation on interview process set expectations well within timeframe prior to interview.  The campus can be difficult to navigate but supplied information helped.
Interview Questions: Describe my biggest failure on the job.

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: First you get an interview with the phone recruiter. If they deem you valuabe, they will set up interviews with hiring managers. After you meet with the hiring manager, if they like you, the process is very quick. However, orientation may take awhile for you to get to. But overall it's a pretty smooth process.
Interview Questions: Why  do  you  want  to   work  for  Cleveland  Clinic?

title: Systems Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Phone and in person interviews.
Interview Questions: Just usual interview type questions. Also talk about technical background.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Internal applicant, so process was fairly straight forward.  Spoke with HR, met with corporate leader, met with site hospital VP.  Typical behavioral interview questions asked.  Heard back within a week or two.  HR contacted with offer and next steps.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Hemodialysis Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: very detailed very professional on time with interview staff was very nice latest and up to date equipment
Interview Questions: no question I found to be diffuicult

title: PBX Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Overall very easy interview. Hiring manager was very welcoming and made me feel comfortable. He did not question me like other jobs typical interview questions. He spoke as if i already had the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Quality Improvement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: You look for job postings online & fill out an online application.  There are online tests you need to take based on the position you apply for.  All employees must take the culture screening test to see if you would be a good fit for the organization & I believe if you aren't a fit your process stops at that point..HR doesn't release any info forward regarding candidates that don't fit the initial cultural screening.  There can be other online tests re the exact position such as multitasking, story problems, etc.  Next step was a phone interview with HR, followed by face to face interviews with a variety of people from the dept I would work in.  the interviews were open, pleasant, respectful, & personable.
Interview Questions: A lot of the questions were behavioral based questions "tell me about a time when you.."

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: have to be able to lift >100 lb. for clinic to hire you
Interview Questions: what are your weaknesses

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: When seeking employment through the Cleveland Clinic I filled out an application on the Cleveland Clinic career website. I received a call from a recruiter working in the HR department. From here I reviewed my qualifications and scheduled an initial in person interview. I had one in person interview and then was extended a job offer.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were straight forward. No questions standout as being to tough to answer.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed right out of college so if searching for a seasoned position it wouldnt be a smart idea to take my suggestion
Interview Questions: No question was really difficult. More of a conversation style.

title: Medical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Weston, FL) in Feb 2014
