Interview Descriptions: Lengthy 2 days in Florida and 1 day in Clevelamd they put you up in a hotel.  They pack the interview with meeting with the chief and panel and one on one
Interview Questions: Talk to men about some of your weaknesses, strengths and the ability to work with others

title: Pcna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal.  But the manager who interviewed me is no longer with the company.  I did have a chance to "interview" the new manager and she is beyond amazing.  She is a positive role model for our unit, expects the best from all staff, and treats us all as equals.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in nursing?

title: Patient Care Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't intimidating. The manager was nice and friendly. I was asked a lot of questions pertaining to the healthcare industry and why i wanted to help others. The interview went well and I felt very welcomed. I was offered the job and I accepted. I also shadowed the floor where I would be working. Make sure you are engaged and ask if the patients on that floor are heavy which equal a 3.
Interview Questions:
What would you do in certain scenarios?
Why do you want to help others?
Why do you want to work for the clinic?

title: IT Asset Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Technical recruiter performs a telephone interview with standard questions looking to knock you off the list. Next interview was with the hiring manager and 2 departmental staff with very standard questions. Next interviews were with many of the departments you would interface with. There was a breakdown in the number of people who were scheduled versus who actually came to the interview.
Interview Questions: All standard very easy questions.

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply, 2 days later done the initial phone interview in 2weeks have gone to in site interview with two different  groups <<< was so confident. They are big on taking the best ones based on their resume .... Dont think that if they asked for a bachelor degree will take it, here the bug chance is for  master holders while they are applying too.
Interview Questions: Education, work history, behavioral questions

title: Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy, thorough and precise. Applied on line, had a phone interview afterward and did some shadowing prior to be considered. That was very helpful in my opinion.

There was a skills assessment offered and because I had taken one already for another position, it was included and sent ahead to the manager.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Clinical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received an email to set up a time for a phone interview. I spoke with a recruiter who asked me mostly about my previous experience and a few personality based/ situational questions. From there she set me up with an in person interview. In this interview I shadowed a current employee, and got a feel of the unit and job I applied for. The manager asked me a few personality based questions, and elaborated on my experience.
Interview Questions: What is integrity?

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: It depends on the position you are applying for.  Most start with a phone interview and then move on to a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: I can't really say, it depends on the position you are going for.  Sometimes the situational questions can be difficult especially when you don't have experience in that area.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: phone interview followed by in person
Interview Questions: tell me a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Initially contacted by Human Resources for a phone screening.  Made it through to first round where I met with two department managers who were very nice.  We talked a lot about projects they had going on and I commented on how my experience and qualifications would fit their projects.  We had a very good rapport.
Made it to the next round, meeting with the department's director.  She was friendly, smart and approachable.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected.  I did my homework on the department, their mission, their most recent projects and the employees that work there.

title: Web Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: After the online application, I was invited to meet with the hiring supervisor for a one-on-one interview which gave me a good impression of the job responsibilities. Then I met with the rest of the team who asked more technical questions. It gave me a good overview of the department and a positive impression of the work environment. The interviews lasted approximately 2 hours.
Interview Questions: The team grilled me on detailed database theory issues, which wasn't easy at first but it gave me a good impression of their engagement.

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had a direct interview scheduled without a phone screening.  They flew me out to Cleveland Clinic (all travel expenses paid through them), stayed at the attached Intercontinental Hotel, then had a series of interviews with various leadership throughout many different departments, a lunch interview, and a very tough panel interview with two other candidates (one was another student from my grad program).
Interview Questions: They provided an Advisory Board Daily Briefing from that morning and asked us to pick one of the three topics, form an opinion and defend it.

title: IT Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Internship fair - interviewing with several companies. We were all scheduled to meet with different companies at different times, not typical career fair. Then companies gave us feedback on our interview skills. Most comfortable interview of the day. Great HR person - discussed resume and work experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time... STAR questions.

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Professional, friendly, welcoming, and met many members of management
Interview Questions: I don't recall having any questions that were unexpected.

title: Resident Surgeon Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions: Lutheran Medical Center is a 400-500 bed hospital serving the area of Sunset Park, Brooklyn, New York. The director of the training program in surgery Dr. Michael Golding improved the training program in surgery and added a fellowship in vascular and another in general surgery. The interview and hiring process may be described as routine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Post Doc Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: it was in person interview, I met PI for the project to discuss my research experience and scientific achievements. I was offerered a position at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: NICU RRT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Had a call with the HR person after doing all the online work (submitting the resume, the personality test, and the multitask test). Met with RT Supervisor and NICU RT Manager.
Interview Questions: What is one of your most memorable shifts?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic

title: Staff Nuclear Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for initial pre screen.. I was asked many questions just like a face to face interview. I was asked 3 different ways my salary requirements. Tried not to give a number but manager got pretty upset until I gave an actual figure. This probably did not get my interview off to a good start. She started off with a laughable low hourly rate. I pleasantly stated that it was a low offer but I was willing to wait and see what the entire benefits package would be. She came back and wanted to know what amount I was looking for. I told her I researched the position on the Cleveland Clinic website which actually posts average salaries. I told her the posted amounts are acceptable. Then she said, I don't think you understand the question...how much are you looking for...and seemed pretty aggressive at this point. She went on to ask questions about my resume and history but it never felt friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you went above And beyond for a patient?  What are your 2 best qualities? What would you do if you were inconvenienced with your schedule and how would you handle it?

title: Med-Surg Telemetry Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied -> Called by recruiter -> Arranged for in person interview -> In person interview -> Received congratulatory email. Took a long time. Probably not enough recruiters. Interviewed with a couple of nurse managers and shadowed a nurse on my interview dqay.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you resolved a conflict between two people. What was the conflict?

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic
Interview Descriptions:
Their website didn't accept electronic copy of my resume. Instead I had  to fill in my qualifications (experience/awards/education/etc) in their web-based form. To make it worse, the web-based application form is broken:

- I had to select the universities I attended from a drop down menu. My undergraduate school (one of the biggest universities in the US) was not even listed there. So I had to select "OTHER".
- The web based form doesn't have room to fully list your degrees.  For instance, "PhD" is not even an option in their drop-down menus. So, I was required to mention where I got my highschool diploma, but couldn't list my PhD degree. For some reason, the street address of my highschool is more important to them than my graduate degrees.

It took me at least an hour to attempt to select the best available options for my qualifications. The next day after I submitted the application, I received the generic "you have good qualifications, but we are looking for candidates who better fit the position" rejection email... which I found humorous because I literally met every single listed qualification and much more. They didn't even give me a phone interview. At least they had the decency to send a rejection email.
Interview Questions: Address of your High school. (on their application form)

title: Residency Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: A lengthy process for any professional level administrative job or any clinical job.  Online pre-testing to tease out personality, management style and attitudes. Must pass the online test to get a further look so take it seriously. Multiple full-day interviews often set-up with very little lead time or preparation time for the interviewee.  One on one and group interviews with all the relevant people.  Social media -- better have a squeaky clean history if you want a job here.  Integrity is the name of the game.  Once you are invited for an interview on-site the process may move quickly depending upon how many other candidates are interviewing and where you are in the line-up and then it will slow again before you'll hear news as they check out your references and your background check.  It is an intense selection process -- not for the faint of heart or anyone in a hurry.  They are discerning and you'll know it by the process!  Zero information about salary range or benefits until an offer is made so you go with the flow and then assess the package when you get an offer  -- apparently this is the CCF way of doing things.  A bit of going with the flow in blind faith that the compensation package will match your expectations and your needs. You'll feel you've earned an offer if you get one!  For me the process was long but a good experience.  Must pass an employee drug and nicotine screening or your offer will be withdrawn.  Don't let all of this scare you -- you want to work for an organization that this particular about who they hire to represent them!
Interview Questions: Pretty much what you would expect.  No surprises.  The online testing was the most surprising  because you go into it without a clear idea how intense it is, how lengthy the test really is and that there would be so many seemingly irrelevant questions and timed activities you have to complete.  But apparently this must tell them a great deal since it is the first filter for moving forward.  I can bet it does separate out candidates since some probably quit or don't take it seriously only to find they do not advance.  So, put on your thinking cap but realize you can't study up for this test!

title: OFFICE SPECIALIST Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is incredibly slow and delayed. First you submit the online application which is forward to the HR department. Next you would have a brief phone interview with the HR rep. If you apply for multiple jobs, you do the phone interview for each job even though the questions are similar if not identical. If they think you are qualified for the position you applied for, they forward it to the department supervisor, who states whether or not they want to interview you. If they want you, the HR person sets up an interview. You interview with the department supervisor and then they will tell the HR if they are interested in you or not and what the offer is. (After my interview, the manager emailed HR right away to express interest and they did not contact me for 3 weeks! I ended up emailing her and she had to put a second request for me to be contacted) Then you go back and forth with the HR person on the offer and once you accept your training starts about a week after you get your paperwork and health clearance done at Main Campus.
Interview Questions: They want you to describe a few of your flaws, which is always a Catch 22 at an interview. You don't want to tell them how you can be a poor employee, but you don't want to appear as if you can't criticize yourself.

HR took so long to offer me the position I almost gave up.
Interview Questions: During my in person interview I was shown how to locate medical charts, and then I was tested to see if I could find charts by myself without any help.

title: Administrator Quality Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I found out about the job through my staffing agency.  She sent my resume to the department heads who had decided to ues outside agencies to move the job search along.  They liked my resume and immidiately responded requesting an interview.  I accepted and went on the interview about 2 weeks later due to holidays, etc.  I did not go through their HR and interviewed directly with the the department heads, which consisted of a doctor and a manager.  The interview process went very well, they answered all of my questions and we all left very pleased.  My agency called to tell me that I was one of the front runners and they really really liked me; however, I would now have to complete the Clinic online application take an assessment to even qualifty for the job.  Usually when you go through an agency, this part is bypassed, but I guess everyone has to eventually go through the HR process to get hired.  I did what I was told and received an email from HR requesting another interview.  I completed that interview by answering your basic interview questions and felt really good after.  I then got a call from my agency saying they were going to pass on me.  I'm not sure what happened, possibly the assessment, the background check, just not sure.  While I have no criminal record, I do have less than stellar credit due to being unemployed for a few years and have had a few bankruptcies.  I would hope that the Clinic wouldn't pass on somoneone with my qualifications because of that, but you never know.
Interview Questions: What interested you abou this position.

Interview Descriptions: The clinic outsources all of their recruiting projects. The 3rd party vendor was very thorough in fulfilling the Clinic's every wish on the list.  If you are missing one qualification out of several that you do have, you're likely still out.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?  Describe your routine when working solo on a project.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Twinsburg, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: It took forever. It was one thing a week cuz I had to call 4 different people to set things up and it was dragging out
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter. Asked general questions to evaluate candidate in situations, personality, expand on skill set, etc.  Told to expect to be contacted in a few weeks.  Still waiting after 21 days.  Was contacted via email and all contact has been thru such. CC is definitely in control of the hiring process b/c you don't know the name of the hiring manager, only the recruiter (who appears to be a 3rd party contractor).  Good luck on finding out what the salary codes means - under lock and key.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a phone call to interview. Interviewed with 5 people. Everyone was nice. Waited a couple weeks. They called me back to take some bs tests and offered me a job. Wasn't too difficult.
Interview Questions: Could I handle sick, nasty attitude patients?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very long, drawn out process. Met with several people within the department -- that lasted a few weeks because not everyone was readily available. Then received a call back to interview further with the clinical side.
Interview Questions: Elaborate on past experience...

title: Process Improvement Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an HR representative for the basic, "is this the right candidate for us", type of interview.  There were some behavioral questions, questions about my salary requirements, and questions about my work history and gaps.  I passed the HR screen, and was given the opportunity to come down to the office to meet with two members of the group: the hiring manager, and a potential Sr. co-worker.  Both interviews were very laid back and it felt more like a personality test and team building experience than a true rigorous "what can you do for me today?" type of interview.  I left on good terms but never heard back.  I followed up several times with the HR representative whom I was supposed to contact but never heard back.  Finally I gave up and instead of asking about the job, I asked whether the hiring manager would ever vouch for me for another position within the company.  This is when it got interesting!  The hiring manager tells me he didn't know why I didn't get the job because I was their "top choice", but he was notified that my salary requirements were too high.  I told him that I didn't have any dead-set requirements and that I used the range that pay grade (14 or 16, I believe) compensated employees.  I may have required $50K, but they were looking for $48.  If that were the case, I'm sure they could have negotiated with me.  I told him this and told him that $48 would not be a deal-breaker.  He tried to contact HR to give the job to me, but after a long snafu of back and forth emails and cross-checking, it ended with him basically back-pedaling saying how it's not his choice but that he couldn't hire me (and even THAT was through interpretation, not actual words!).  So my experience with Cleveland Clinic has been strange, to say the least!
Interview Questions: What are your salary requirements for this position?

title: Systems Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line, Recruiter Screen, Phone Interview with 2 managers, In person panel with 4 people. The in person panel was easy and not a single technical question. Lots of questions about my previous projects and some personality type questions.
Interview Questions: Did not ask technical questions, but did ask about my background.

title: Social Worker III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted of screening interview, in person interview, then offer of employment.  This process went fairly quickly.  I have heard from others that the Clinic process can take some time, but in this case it was all complete within a month or so.  Interview included two supervisors.  None of the questions were difficult.  Interviewers strayed from scripted questions quite a bit to try to get information about fit.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult.

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was very professional and efficient.  The interview was more of a presentation of the HR function in the organization vs. many questions to me as a candidate.  This made me wonder if I was being considered a serious candidate or this was just a quick part of the initial screening process.  The organization is a huge employer in the area and I am sure the response rate to openings is very high.
Interview Questions: The main contributions I would make to the organization.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied from overseas. I had sent an unsolicited email to a PI with my CV. Within a week, I was asked for a Skype video interview. It lasted about 30-45 minutes. In a couple of days, I was offered the position. I negotiated the salary up by $3,000 from the offered $40,000.
Interview Questions:
Q: Briefly describe your past research.
Q: What are you thoughts on the use of scaffolds vs. cells in tissue engineering strategies?

title: Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extremely professional. Human Resources contacted me about two months after I applied for the position for a phone interview. Within two weeks, I had gone in for two face to face interviews with the hiring manager of the department. Everyone was very instrumental in helping it to be a smooth process.
Interview Questions: The questions asked were nothing out of the ordinary, your basic interview questions.

title: Certified Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The Cleveland Clinic was very friendly and efficient. I was very impressed by how well organized and quick the process was.
Interview Questions: In you previous job, if you called off, what did you usually call off for?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2011

The panel was the hiring manager initially and then a panel of my future coworkers.  The questions were behavioral and technical.

title: Director Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview with a team of stakeholders.  Met with individuals as well as a group.  Everyone was very welcoming. After the interview, it took a few days to hear from Human Resources with an offer.  Overall, pretty straightforward.

title: Health Information Assistant Interview

Phone Interview
Group Interview

title: Financial Analyst Interview

The Group/panel interview consisted of different teams going over the resume, asked questions about background, Fit basic behavioral questions & some odd ball questions to test the managerial background & analytical skillset.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jun 2010

I was disqualified the next day with an email stating others were being considered. I emailed the manager whom conducted one of the interviews. I asked how I could have been better qualified for the position and what weak points I could work on. She did not even respond that she received the email.

title: Research Student Interview

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview

title: Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview. Long wait for any return call back. Four month process from initial call. Panel interview if selected and may last up to 3-4 hours depending upon how many people may interview you. They look for education over experience, some things you just cannot learn from the book.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: First online application, then three separate interviews in person, then back again for testing, and one more time for health screening. I am not but I can tell you don't bother applying if you are a smoker.

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty simple.  I met with the head of the department and then with work leaders of the department.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult.  Your standard questions: personality, experiences, and how you would handle situations.  They are really big on patient satisfaction.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email informing me of a graduate program available at the Cleveland Clinic through Case Western Reserve University.  I applied to the program.  I was then offered to interview with the program.  I was given a series of three interviews over the course of a weekend, as well as was introduced to present graduate students within the program, given a brief tour of our facilities, and was briefly taken around Cleveland to experience Cleveland.  I was then accepted as one of ten for the incoming class out of thirty-some interviewees.  I very quickly got the impression it is an exceedingly professional environment (which has certain downsides, especially when compared to other realms of academic science), where most people were working exceedingly hard and long with relatively little compensation, but that their needs were well-provided for and that this was a top-tier institution to work for.
Interview Questions: I was asked about how I would address certain specific problems in making a transgenic model organism and asked about my technical knowledge regarding how to make such an organism.  I was also asked about my future plans, which at the time I was unaware of

title: Scientist Interview

title: Medical Technologist Interview

title: Part Time Officer Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Cleveland, OH) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Overal, the hiring and interviewing experieince was seemingly standard. The initial showing of interest is through a phone call or email. Then just the drug screening and immunization verification. It's my understanding they've added a personality assessment at some point in the process.

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview

Interview Questions: "Can you leave the workplace behind at the end of the day?"

title: Cardiopulmonary Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cleveland Clinic (Warrensville Heights, OH) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Before I applied for the position I researched the job description as well as did a salary analysis of the position. I sent a packet which included my CV and a presentation outlining my accomplishments in health care management. Initial communication from the hospital came through the secretary of the VP of operations.  My first interview was with the VP of operations who was also in charge of all ancillary services.  She asked me a series of question regarding my experience in the field and in managment.  She also asked me some questions based on scenarios that had occurred regarding employee relations.  The department was experiencing staffing shortages as well as no department director and I from her description, I could only imagine the tension and their frustration. I was asked about my goals and where I envisioned myself 5 years from now.  The VP took me on a tour of the hospital and then took me back to her office where she asked if I could come back the next day to be intereview by some of the doctors.  I came back the following day and was interviewed by the 2 pulmonologists whom I already knew from a previous supervisory position at the hospital. There were really no in-depth interview questions except to ask how I was doing over the last few years and to confirm my thoughts that the department was in turmoil and needed additional guidance.  I was supposed to have an interview with the cardiopulmonary staff so they could "check me out" and see if I was someone they could relate to for their issues.  Due to the heavy patient load and no time, I was asked to come back again 2 days later for the staff interview.  The staff interview was interesting in that I knew a couple of the therapists already and felt comfortable with the questions that I was being asked.  My confidence was high, and it showed in my answers and the staff reactions.  I was even put "on the spot" by ome particular staff member who challenged me with questions about disciplinary action.  All in all the interview felt very successful.  In the end, however, even though I posessed a bachelor's degree in health administration, I was passed over for the job by someone with a master's degree but no supervisory experience.  It showed me that some facilities will take a degree over experience.
Interview Questions: What three words best describe you as a person?
